1.a:
Blessed are they who have not walked
    in the counsel of the wicked,  ♦
1.b:
nor lingered in the way of sinners,
    nor sat in the assembly of the scornful.

1.a: Their delight is in the law of the Lord  ♦
1.b: and they meditate on his law day and night.

1.a:
Like a tree planted by streams of water
    bearing fruit in due season, with leaves that do not wither,  ♦
1.b: whatever they do, it shall prosper.

1.a: As for the wicked, it is not so with them;  ♦
1.b: they are like chaff which the wind blows away.

1.a: Therefore the wicked shall not be able to stand in the judgement,  ♦
1.b: nor the sinner in the congregation of the righteous.

1.a: For the Lord knows the way of the righteous,  ♦
1.b: but the way of the wicked shall perish.

2.a: Why are the nations in tumult,  ♦
2.b: and why do the peoples devise a vain plot?

2.a:
The kings of the earth rise up,
    and the rulers take counsel together,  ♦
2.b: against the Lord and against his anointed:
and cast away their cords from us.’

2.a: He who dwells in heaven shall laugh them to scorn;  ♦
2.b: the Lord shall have them in derision.

2.a: Then shall he speak to them in his wrath  ♦
2.b: and terrify them in his fury:
upon my holy hill of Zion.’

2.a: I will proclaim the decree of the Lord;  ♦
2.b: he said to me: ‘You are my Son; this day have I begotten you.

2.a: ‘Ask of me and I will give you the nations for your inheritance  ♦
2.b: and the ends of the earth for your possession.

2.a: ‘You shall break them with a rod of iron  ♦
2.b: and dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.’

2.a: Now therefore be wise, O kings;  ♦
2.b: be prudent, you judges of the earth.

2.a: Serve the Lord with fear, and with trembling kiss his feet,  ♦
2.b:
lest he be angry and you perish from the way,
    for his wrath is quickly kindled.

3.a: Lord, how many are my adversaries;  ♦
3.b: many are they who rise up against me.

3.a: Many are they who say to my soul,  ♦
3.b: ‘There is no help for you in your God.’

3.a: But you, Lord, are a shield about me;  ♦
3.b: you are my glory, and the lifter up of my head.

3.a: When I cry aloud to the Lord,  ♦
3.b: he will answer me from his holy hill;

3.a: I lie down and sleep and rise again,  ♦
I will not be afraid of hordes of the peoples  ♦
3.b: that have set themselves against me all around.

3.a: Rise up, O Lord, and deliver me, O my God,  ♦
3.b:
for you strike all my enemies on the cheek
    and break the teeth of the wicked.
may your blessing be upon your people.

4.a: Answer me when I call, O God of my righteousness;  ♦
4.b:
you set me at liberty when I was in trouble;
    have mercy on me and hear my prayer.

4.a: How long will you nobles dishonour my glory;  ♦
4.b: how long will you love vain things and seek after falsehood?

4.a: But know that the Lord has shown me his marvellous kindness;  ♦
4.b: when I call upon the Lord, he will hear me.

4.a: Stand in awe, and sin not;  ♦
4.b: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still.
and put your trust in the Lord.

4.a: There are many that say, ‘Who will show us any good?’  ♦
4.b: Lord, lift up the light of your countenance upon us.

4.a: You have put gladness in my heart,  ♦
4.b: more than when their corn and wine and oil increase.

4.a: In peace I will lie down and sleep,  ♦
4.b: for it is you Lord, only, who make me dwell in safety.

5.a: Give ear to my words, O Lord;  ♦
Hearken to the voice of my crying, my King and my God,  ♦
5.b: for to you I make my prayer.

5.a: In the morning, Lord, you will hear my voice;  ♦
5.b: early in the morning I make my appeal to you, and look up.

5.a: For you are the God who takes no pleasure in wickedness;  ♦
5.b: no evil can dwell with you.

5.a: The boastful cannot stand in your sight;  ♦
5.b: you hate all those that work wickedness.

5.a: You destroy those who speak lies;  ♦
5.b: the bloodthirsty and deceitful the Lord will abhor.

5.a:
But as for me, through the greatness of your mercy,
    I will come into your house;  ♦
5.b: I will bow down towards your holy temple in awe of you.

5.a:
Lead me, Lord, in your righteousness,
    because of my enemies;  ♦
5.b: make your way straight before my face.

5.a:
For there is no truth in their mouth,
    in their heart is destruction,  ♦
5.b:
their throat is an open sepulchre,
    and they flatter with their tongue.
let them fall through their own devices.

5.a: Because of their many transgressions cast them out,  ♦
5.b: for they have rebelled against you.

5.a: But let all who take refuge in you be glad;  ♦
5.b: let them sing out their joy for ever.
so that those who love your name may exult in you.

5.a: For you, O Lord, will bless the righteous;  ♦
5.b: and with your favour you will defend them as with a shield.

6.a: O Lord, rebuke me not in your wrath;  ♦
6.b: neither chasten me in your fierce anger.

6.a: Have mercy on me, Lord, for I am weak;  ♦
6.b: Lord, heal me, for my bones are racked.

6.a: My soul also shakes with terror;  ♦
6.b: how long, O Lord, how long?

6.a: Turn again, O Lord, and deliver my soul;  ♦
6.b: save me for your loving mercy’s sake.

6.a: For in death no one remembers you;  ♦
6.b: and who can give you thanks in the grave?

6.a: I am weary with my groaning;  ♦
6.b:
every night I drench my pillow
    and flood my bed with my tears.

6.a: My eyes are wasted with grief  ♦
6.b: and worn away because of all my enemies.

6.a: Depart from me, all you that do evil,  ♦
6.b: for the Lord has heard the voice of my weeping.

6.a: The Lord has heard my supplication;  ♦
6.b: the Lord will receive my prayer.

6.a: All my enemies shall be put to shame and confusion;  ♦
6.b: they shall suddenly turn back in their shame.

7.a: O Lord my God, in you I take refuge;  ♦
7.b: save me from all who pursue me, and deliver me,

7.a: Lest they rend me like a lion and tear me in pieces  ♦
7.b: while there is no one to help me.

7.a: O Lord my God, if I have done these things:  ♦
7.b: if there is any wickedness in my hands,

7.a: If I have repaid my friend with evil,  ♦
7.b: or plundered my enemy without a cause,

7.a: Then let my enemy pursue me and overtake me,  ♦
7.b:
trample my life to the ground,
    and lay my honour in the dust.

7.a:
Rise up, O Lord, in your wrath;
    lift yourself up against the fury of my enemies.  ♦
7.b: Awaken, my God, the judgement that you have commanded.

7.a: Let the assembly of the peoples gather round you;  ♦
7.b: be seated high above them: O Lord, judge the nations.

7.a:
Give judgement for me
    according to my righteousness, O Lord,  ♦
7.b: and according to the innocence that is in me.

7.a:
Let the malice of the wicked come to an end,
    but establish the righteous;  ♦
7.b: for you test the mind and heart, O righteous God.

7.a: God is my shield that is over me;  ♦
7.b: he saves the true of heart.
he is provoked all day long.

7.a: If they will not repent, God will whet his sword;  ♦
7.b: he has bent his bow and made it ready.

7.a: He has prepared the weapons of death;  ♦
7.b: he makes his arrows shafts of fire.

7.a: Behold those who are in labour with wickedness,  ♦
7.b: who conceive evil and give birth to lies.

7.a: They dig a pit and make it deep  ♦
7.b: and fall into the hole that they have made for others.

7.a: Their mischief rebounds on their own head;  ♦
7.b: their violence falls on their own scalp.

7.a: I will give thanks to the Lord for his righteousness,  ♦
7.b: and I will make music to the name of the Lord Most High.

8.b: how glorious is your name in all the world!

8.a: Your majesty above the heavens is praised  ♦
8.b: out of the mouths of babes at the breast.

8.a: You have founded a stronghold against your foes,  ♦
8.b: that you might still the enemy and the avenger.

8.a: When I consider your heavens, the work of your fingers,  ♦
8.b: the moon and the stars that you have ordained,

8.a: What is man, that you should be mindful of him;  ♦
8.b: the son of man, that you should seek him out?

8.a: You have made him little lower than the angels  ♦
8.b: and crown him with glory and honour.

8.a: You have given him dominion over the works of your hands  ♦
8.b: and put all things under his feet,
even the wild beasts of the field,

8.a: The birds of the air, the fish of the sea  ♦
8.b: and whatsoever moves in the paths of the sea.
how glorious is your name in all the world!

9.a: I will give thanks to you, Lord, with my whole heart;  ♦
9.b: I will tell of all your marvellous works.

9.a: I will be glad and rejoice in you;  ♦
9.b: I will make music to your name, O Most High.

9.a: When my enemies are driven back,  ♦
9.b: they stumble and perish at your presence.

9.a: For you have maintained my right and my cause;  ♦
9.b: you sat on your throne giving righteous judgement.

9.a: You have rebuked the nations and destroyed the wicked;  ♦
9.b: you have blotted out their name for ever and ever.

9.a: The enemy was utterly laid waste.  ♦
9.b:
You uprooted their cities;
    their very memory has perished.

9.a: But the Lord shall endure for ever;  ♦
9.b: he has made fast his throne for judgement.

9.a: For he shall rule the world with righteousness  ♦
9.b: and govern the peoples with equity.

9.a: Then will the Lord be a refuge for the oppressed,  ♦
9.b: a refuge in the time of trouble.

9.a: And those who know your name will put their trust in you,  ♦
9.b: for you, Lord, have never failed those who seek you.

9.a: Sing praises to the Lord who dwells in Zion;  ♦
9.b: declare among the peoples the things he has done.

9.a: The avenger of blood has remembered them;  ♦
9.b: he did not forget the cry of the oppressed.

9.a: Have mercy upon me, O Lord;  ♦
9.b:
consider the trouble I suffer from those who hate me,
    you that lift me up from the gates of death;

9.a: That I may tell all your praises in the gates of the city of Zion  ♦
9.b: and rejoice in your salvation.

9.a: The nations shall sink into the pit of their making  ♦
9.b: and in the snare which they set will their own foot be taken.

9.a: The Lord makes himself known by his acts of justice;  ♦
9.b: the wicked are snared in the works of their own hands.

9.a: They shall return to the land of darkness,  ♦
9.b: all the nations that forget God.

9.a: For the needy shall not always be forgotten  ♦
9.b: and the hope of the poor shall not perish for ever.

9.a: Arise, O Lord, and let not mortals have the upper hand;  ♦
9.b: let the nations be judged before your face.

9.a: Put them in fear, O Lord,  ♦
9.b: that the nations may know themselves to be but mortal.

10.a: Why stand so far off, O Lord?  ♦
10.b: Why hide yourself in time of trouble?

10.a: The wicked in their pride persecute the poor;  ♦
10.b: let them be caught in the schemes they have devised.

10.a: The wicked boast of their heart’s desire;  ♦
10.b: the covetous curse and revile the Lord.

10.a: The wicked in their arrogance say, ‘God will not avenge it’;  ♦
10.b: in all their scheming God counts for nothing.

10.a:
They are stubborn in all their ways,
    for your judgements are far above out of their sight;  ♦
10.b: they scoff at all their adversaries.

10.a: They say in their heart, ‘I shall not be shaken;  ♦
10.b: no harm shall ever happen to me.’

10.a: Their mouth is full of cursing, deceit and fraud;  ♦
10.b: under their tongue lie mischief and wrong.

10.a:
They lurk in the outskirts
    and in dark alleys they murder the innocent;  ♦
10.b: their eyes are ever watching for the helpless.

10.a:
They lie in wait, like a lion in his den;
    they lie in wait to seize the poor;  ♦
10.b: they seize the poor when they get them into their net.

10.a: The innocent are broken and humbled before them;  ♦
10.b: the helpless fall before their power.

10.a: They say in their heart, ‘God has forgotten;  ♦
10.b: he hides his face away; he will never see it.’

10.a: Arise, O Lord God, and lift up your hand;  ♦
Why should the wicked be scornful of God?  ♦
10.b: Why should they say in their hearts, ‘You will not avenge it’?

10.a: Surely, you behold trouble and misery;  ♦
10.b: you see it and take it into your own hand.

10.a: The helpless commit themselves to you,  ♦
10.b: for you are the helper of the orphan.

10.a: Break the power of the wicked and malicious;  ♦
10.b: search out their wickedness until you find none.

10.a: The Lord shall reign for ever and ever;  ♦
10.b: the nations shall perish from his land.

10.a: Lord, you will hear the desire of the poor;  ♦
10.b: you will incline your ear to the fullness of their heart,

10.a: To give justice to the orphan and oppressed,  ♦
10.b: so that people are no longer driven in terror from the land.

11.a: In the Lord have I taken refuge;  ♦
11.b:
how then can you say to me,
    ‘Flee like a bird to the hills,

11.a:
‘For see how the wicked bend the bow
    and fit their arrows to the string,  ♦
11.b: to shoot from the shadows at the true of heart.

11.a: The Lord is in his holy temple;  ♦
11.b: the Lord’s throne is in heaven.
his eyelids try every mortal being.

11.a: The Lord tries the righteous as well as the wicked,  ♦
11.b: but those who delight in violence his soul abhors.

11.a:
Upon the wicked he shall rain coals of fire
    and burning sulphur;  ♦
11.b: scorching wind shall be their portion to drink.

11.a:
For the Lord is righteous;
    he loves righteous deeds,  ♦
11.b: and those who are upright shall behold his face.

12.a: Help me, Lord, for no one godly is left;  ♦
12.b: the faithful have vanished from the whole human race.

12.a: They all speak falsely with their neighbour;  ♦
12.b: they flatter with their lips, but speak from a double heart.

12.a: O that the Lord would cut off all flattering lips  ♦
12.b: and the tongue that speaks proud boasts!

12.a: Those who say, ‘With our tongue will we prevail;  ♦
12.b: our lips we will use; who is lord over us?’

12.a:
‘Because of the oppression of the needy,
    and the groaning of the poor,  ♦
12.b:
I will rise up now,’ says the Lord,
    ‘and set them in the safety that they long for.’

12.a: The words of the Lord are pure words,  ♦
12.b:
like silver refined in the furnace
    and purified seven times in the fire.

12.a: You, O Lord, will watch over us  ♦
12.b: and guard us from this generation for ever.

12.a: The wicked strut on every side,  ♦
12.b: when what is vile is exalted by the whole human race.

13.a: How long will you forget me, O Lord; for ever?  ♦
13.b: How long will you hide your face from me?

13.a:
How long shall I have anguish in my soul
    and grief in my heart, day after day?  ♦
13.b: How long shall my enemy triumph over me?

13.a: Look upon me and answer, O Lord my God;  ♦
13.b: lighten my eyes, lest I sleep in death;

13.a: Lest my enemy say, ‘I have prevailed against him,’  ♦
13.b: and my foes rejoice that I have fallen.

13.a: But I put my trust in your steadfast love;  ♦
13.b: my heart will rejoice in your salvation.

13.a: I will sing to the Lord,  ♦
13.b: for he has dealt so bountifully with me.

14.a: The fool has said in his heart, ‘There is no God.’  ♦
14.b:
Corrupt are they, and abominable in their wickedness;
    there is no one that does good.

14.a:
The Lord has looked down from heaven
    upon the children of earth,  ♦
14.b:
to see if there is anyone who is wise
    and seeks after God.

14.a:
But every one has turned back;
    all alike have become corrupt:  ♦
14.b: there is none that does good; no, not one.

14.a: Have they no knowledge, those evildoers,  ♦
14.b:
who eat up my people as if they ate bread
    and do not call upon the Lord?

14.a: There shall they be in great fear;  ♦
14.b: for God is in the company of the righteous.

14.a: Though they would confound the counsel of the poor,  ♦
14.b: yet the Lord shall be their refuge.

14.a: O that Israel’s salvation would come out of Zion!  ♦
14.b:
When the Lord restores the fortunes of his people,
    then will Jacob rejoice and Israel be glad.

15.a: Lord, who may dwell in your tabernacle?  ♦
15.b: Who may rest upon your holy hill?
and does the thing that is right;

15.a: Who speaks the truth from the heart  ♦
15.b: and bears no deceit on the tongue;

15.a: Who does no evil to a friend  ♦
15.b: and pours no scorn on a neighbour;

15.a: In whose sight the wicked are not esteemed,  ♦
15.b: but who honours those who fear the Lord.

15.a: Whoever has sworn to a neighbour  ♦
15.b: and never goes back on that word;

15.a: Who does not lend money in hope of gain,  ♦
15.b: nor takes a bribe against the innocent;

16.a: Preserve me, O God, for in you have I taken refuge;  ♦
16.b:
I have said to the Lord, ‘You are my lord,
    all my good depends on you.’

16.a: All my delight is upon the godly that are in the land,  ♦
16.b: upon those who are noble in heart.

16.a: Though the idols are legion that many run after,  ♦
16.b:
their drink offerings of blood I will not offer,
    neither make mention of their names upon my lips.

16.a: The Lord himself is my portion and my cup;  ♦
16.b: in your hands alone is my fortune.

16.a: My share has fallen in a fair land;  ♦
16.b: indeed, I have a goodly heritage.

16.a: I will bless the Lord who has given me counsel,  ♦
16.b: and in the night watches he instructs my heart.

16.a: I have set the Lord always before me;  ♦
16.b: he is at my right hand; I shall not fall.

16.a: Wherefore my heart is glad and my spirit rejoices;  ♦
16.b: my flesh also shall rest secure.

16.a: For you will not abandon my soul to Death,  ♦
16.b: nor suffer your faithful one to see the Pit.

16.a:
You will show me the path of life;
    in your presence is the fullness of joy  ♦
16.b: and in your right hand are pleasures for evermore.

17.a: Hear my just cause, O Lord; consider my complaint;  ♦
17.b: listen to my prayer, which comes not from lying lips.

17.a: Let my vindication come forth from your presence;  ♦
17.b: let your eyes behold what is right.

17.a: Weigh my heart, examine me by night,  ♦
17.b: refine me, and you will find no impurity in me.

17.a: My mouth does not trespass for earthly rewards;  ♦
17.b: I have heeded the words of your lips.

17.a: My footsteps hold fast in the ways of your commandments;  ♦
17.b: my feet have not stumbled in your paths.

17.a: I call upon you, O God, for you will answer me;  ♦
17.b: incline your ear to me, and listen to my words.

O Saviour of those who take refuge at your right hand
    from those who rise up against them.

17.a: Keep me as the apple of your eye;  ♦
17.b: hide me under the shadow of your wings,

17.a: From the wicked who assault me,  ♦
17.b: from my enemies who surround me to take away my life.

17.a: They have closed their heart to pity  ♦
17.b: and their mouth speaks proud things.

17.a: They press me hard, they surround me on every side,  ♦
17.b: watching how they may cast me to the ground,

17.a: Like a lion that is greedy for its prey,  ♦
17.b: like a young lion lurking in secret places.

17.a: Arise, Lord; confront them and cast them down;  ♦
17.b: deliver me from the wicked by your sword.

17.a: Deliver me, O Lord, by your hand  ♦
17.b: from those whose portion in life is unending,

17.a: Whose bellies you fill with your treasure,  ♦
17.b:
who are well supplied with children
    and leave their wealth to their little ones.

17.a: As for me, I shall see your face in righteousness;  ♦
17.b: when I awake and behold your likeness, I shall be satisfied.

18.a: I love you, O Lord my strength.  ♦
18.b: The Lord is my crag, my fortress and my deliverer,

18.a: My God, my rock in whom I take refuge,  ♦
18.b: my shield, the horn of my salvation and my stronghold.

18.a: I cried to the Lord in my anguish  ♦
18.b: and I was saved from my enemies.

18.a: The cords of death entwined me  ♦
18.b: and the torrents of destruction overwhelmed me.

18.a: The cords of the Pit fastened about me  ♦
18.b: and the snares of death entangled me.

18.a: In my distress I called upon the Lord  ♦
18.b: and cried out to my God for help.

18.a: He heard my voice in his temple  ♦
18.b: and my cry came to his ears.

18.a: The earth trembled and quaked;  ♦
18.b:
the foundations of the mountains shook;
    they reeled because he was angry.

18.a:
Smoke rose from his nostrils
    and a consuming fire went out of his mouth;  ♦
18.b: burning coals blazed forth from him.

18.a: He parted the heavens and came down  ♦
18.b: and thick darkness was under his feet.

18.a: He rode upon the cherubim and flew;  ♦
18.b: he came flying on the wings of the wind.

18.a: He made darkness his covering round about him,  ♦
18.b: dark waters and thick clouds his pavilion.

18.a: From the brightness of his presence, through the clouds  ♦
18.b: burst hailstones and coals of fire.

18.a: The Lord also thundered out of heaven;  ♦
18.b:
the Most High uttered his voice
    with hailstones and coals of fire.

18.a: He sent out his arrows and scattered them;  ♦
18.b: he hurled down lightnings and put them to flight.

18.a:
The springs of the ocean were seen,
    and the foundations of the world uncovered  ♦
18.b:
at your rebuke, O Lord,
    at the blast of the breath of your displeasure.

18.a: He reached down from on high and took me;  ♦
18.b: he drew me out of the mighty waters.

18.a: He delivered me from my strong enemy,  ♦
18.b: from foes that were too mighty for me.

18.a: They came upon me in the day of my trouble;  ♦
18.b: but the Lord was my upholder.

18.a: He brought me out into a place of liberty;  ♦
18.b: he rescued me because he delighted in me.

18.a: The Lord rewarded me after my righteous dealing;  ♦
18.b: according to the cleanness of my hands he recompensed me,

18.a: Because I had kept the ways of the Lord  ♦
18.b: and had not gone wickedly away from my God,

18.a: For I had an eye to all his laws,  ♦
18.b: and did not cast out his commandments from me.

18.a: I was also wholehearted before him  ♦
18.b: and kept myself from iniquity;

18.a:
Therefore the Lord rewarded me
    after my righteous dealing,  ♦
18.b: and according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.

18.a: With the faithful you show yourself faithful;  ♦
18.b: with the true you show yourself true;

18.a: With the pure you show yourself pure,  ♦
18.b: but with the crooked you show yourself perverse.

18.a: For you will save a lowly people  ♦
18.b: and bring down the high looks of the proud.

18.a: You also shall light my candle;  ♦
18.b: the Lord my God shall make my darkness to be bright.

18.a: By your help I shall run at an enemy host;  ♦
18.b: with the help of my God I can leap over a wall.

18.a:
As for God, his way is perfect;
    the word of the Lord is tried in the fire;  ♦
18.b: he is a shield to all who trust in him.

18.a: For who is God but the Lord,  ♦
18.b: and who is the rock except our God?

18.a: It is God who girds me about with strength  ♦
18.b: and makes my way perfect.

18.a: He makes my feet like hinds’ feet  ♦
18.b: so that I tread surely on the heights.

18.a: He teaches my hands to fight  ♦
18.b: and my arms to bend a bow of bronze.

18.a: You have given me the shield of your salvation;  ♦
18.b:
your right hand upholds me
    and your grace has made me great.

18.a: You enlarge my strides beneath me,  ♦
18.b: yet my feet do not slide.

18.a: I will pursue my enemies and overtake them,  ♦
18.b: nor turn again until I have destroyed them.

18.a: I will smite them down so they cannot rise;  ♦
18.b: they shall fall beneath my feet.

18.a: You have girded me with strength for the battle;  ♦
18.b: you will cast down my enemies under me;

18.a: You will make my foes turn their backs upon me  ♦
18.b: and I shall destroy them that hate me.

18.a: They will cry out, but there shall be none to help them;  ♦
18.b: they will cry to the Lord, but he will not answer.

18.a: I shall beat them as small as the dust on the wind;  ♦
18.b: I will cast them out as the mire in the streets.

18.a: You will deliver me from the strife of the peoples;  ♦
18.b: you will make me the head of the nations.

18.a:
A people I have not known shall serve me;
    as soon as they hear me, they shall obey me;  ♦
18.b: strangers will humble themselves before me.

18.a: The foreign peoples will lose heart  ♦
18.b: and come trembling out of their strongholds.

18.a: The Lord lives, and blessed be my rock!  ♦
18.b: Praised be the God of my salvation,

18.a: Even the God who vindicates me  ♦
18.b: and subdues the peoples under me!

18.a:
You that deliver me from my enemies,
    you will set me up above my foes;  ♦
18.b: from the violent you will deliver me;

18.a: Therefore will I give you thanks, O Lord, among the nations  ♦
18.b: and sing praises to your name,

18.a: To the one who gives great victory to his king  ♦
18.b:
and shows faithful love to his anointed,
    to David and his seed for ever.

19.a: The heavens are telling the glory of God  ♦
19.b: and the firmament proclaims his handiwork.

19.a: One day pours out its song to another  ♦
19.b: and one night unfolds knowledge to another.

19.a: They have neither speech nor language  ♦
19.b: and their voices are not heard,

19.a: Yet their sound has gone out into all lands  ♦
19.b: and their words to the ends of the world.

19.a: In them has he set a tabernacle for the sun,  ♦
19.b:
that comes forth as a bridegroom out of his chamber
    and rejoices as a champion to run his course.

19.a:
It goes forth from the end of the heavens
    and runs to the very end again,  ♦
19.b: and there is nothing hidden from its heat.

19.a: The law of the Lord is perfect, reviving the soul;  ♦
19.b:
the testimony of the Lord is sure
    and gives wisdom to the simple.

19.a: The statutes of the Lord are right and rejoice the heart;  ♦
19.b:
the commandment of the Lord is pure
    and gives light to the eyes.

19.a: The fear of the Lord is clean and endures for ever;  ♦
19.b:
the judgements of the Lord are true
    and righteous altogether.

19.a:
More to be desired are they than gold,
    more than much fine gold,  ♦
19.b:
sweeter also than honey,
    dripping from the honeycomb.

19.a: By them also is your servant taught  ♦
19.b: and in keeping them there is great reward.

19.a: Who can tell how often they offend?  ♦
19.b: O cleanse me from my secret faults!

19.a:
Keep your servant also from presumptuous sins
    lest they get dominion over me;  ♦
19.b:
so shall I be undefiled,
    and innocent of great offence.

19.a:
Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart
    be acceptable in your sight,  ♦
19.b: O Lord, my strength and my redeemer.

20.a: May the Lord hear you in the day of trouble,  ♦
20.b: the name of the God of Jacob defend you;

20.a: Send you help from his sanctuary  ♦
20.b: and strengthen you out of Zion;

20.a:
May we rejoice in your salvation
    and triumph in the name of our God;  ♦
20.b: may the Lord perform all your petitions.

20.a: Now I know that the Lord will save his anointed;  ♦
20.b:
he will answer him from his holy heaven,
    with the mighty strength of his right hand.

20.a: Some put their trust in chariots and some in horses,  ♦
20.b: but we will call only on the name of the Lord our God.

20.a: They are brought down and fallen,  ♦
20.b: but we are risen and stand upright.
and answer us when we call upon you.

21.a: The king shall rejoice in your strength, O Lord;  ♦
21.b: how greatly shall he rejoice in your salvation!

21.a: You have given him his heart’s desire  ♦
21.b: and have not denied the request of his lips.

21.a: For you come to meet him with blessings of goodness  ♦
21.b: and set a crown of pure gold upon his head.

21.a: He asked of you life and you gave it him,  ♦
21.b: length of days, for ever and ever.

21.a: His honour is great because of your salvation;  ♦
21.b: glory and majesty have you laid upon him.

21.a: You have granted him everlasting felicity  ♦
21.b: and will make him glad with joy in your presence.

21.a: For the king puts his trust in the Lord;  ♦
21.b:
because of the loving-kindness of the Most High,
    he shall not be overthrown.

21.a: Your hand shall mark down all your enemies;  ♦
21.b: your right hand will find out those who hate you.

21.a:
You will make them like a fiery oven
    in the time of your wrath;  ♦
21.b:
the Lord will swallow them up in his anger
    and the fire will consume them.

21.a: Their fruit you will root out of the land  ♦
21.b: and their seed from among its inhabitants.

21.a: Because they intend evil against you  ♦
21.b: and devise wicked schemes which they cannot perform,

21.a: You will put them to flight  ♦
21.b: when you aim your bow at their faces.

21.a: Be exalted, O Lord, in your own might;  ♦
21.b: we will make music and sing of your power.

22.a: My God, my God, why have you forsaken me,  ♦
22.b:
and are so far from my salvation,
    from the words of my distress?

22.a:
O my God, I cry in the daytime,
    but you do not answer;  ♦
22.b: and by night also, but I find no rest.

22.a: Yet you are the Holy One,  ♦
22.b: enthroned upon the praises of Israel.

22.a: Our forebears trusted in you;  ♦
22.b: they trusted, and you delivered them.

22.a: They cried out to you and were delivered;  ♦
22.b: they put their trust in you and were not confounded.

22.a: But as for me, I am a worm and no man,  ♦
22.b: scorned by all and despised by the people.

22.a: All who see me laugh me to scorn;  ♦
22.b: they curl their lips and wag their heads, saying,

22.a: ‘He trusted in the Lord; let him deliver him;  ♦
22.b: let him deliver him, if he delights in him.’

22.a: But it is you that took me out of the womb  ♦
22.b: and laid me safe upon my mother’s breast.

22.a: On you was I cast ever since I was born;  ♦
22.b: you are my God even from my mother’s womb.

22.a: Be not far from me, for trouble is near at hand  ♦
22.b: and there is none to help.

22.a: Mighty oxen come around me;  ♦
22.b: fat bulls of Bashan close me in on every side.

22.a: They gape upon me with their mouths,  ♦
22.b: as it were a ramping and a roaring lion.

22.a:
I am poured out like water;
    all my bones are out of joint;  ♦
22.b:
my heart has become like wax
    melting in the depths of my body.

22.a:
My mouth is dried up like a potsherd;
    my tongue cleaves to my gums;  ♦
22.b: you have laid me in the dust of death.

22.a:
For the hounds are all about me,
    the pack of evildoers close in on me;  ♦
22.b: they pierce my hands and my feet.

22.a: I can count all my bones;  ♦
22.b: they stand staring and looking upon me.

22.a: They divide my garments among them;  ♦
22.b: they cast lots for my clothing.

22.a: Be not far from me, O Lord;  ♦
22.b: you are my strength; hasten to help me.

22.a: Deliver my soul from the sword,  ♦
22.b: my poor life from the power of the dog.

22.a:
Save me from the lion’s mouth,
    from the horns of wild oxen.  ♦
22.b: You have answered me!

22.a: I will tell of your name to my people;  ♦
22.b: in the midst of the congregation will I praise you.

22.a: Praise the Lord, you that fear him;  ♦
22.b:
O seed of Jacob, glorify him;
    stand in awe of him, O seed of Israel.

22.a:
For he has not despised nor abhorred the suffering of the poor;
    neither has he hidden his face from them;  ♦
22.b: but when they cried to him he heard them.

22.a: From you comes my praise in the great congregation;  ♦
22.b:
I will perform my vows
    in the presence of those that fear you.

22.a: The poor shall eat and be satisfied;  ♦
22.b:
those who seek the Lord shall praise him;
    their hearts shall live for ever.

22.a:
All the ends of the earth
    shall remember and turn to the Lord,  ♦
22.b: and all the families of the nations shall bow before him.

22.a: For the kingdom is the Lord’s  ♦
22.b: and he rules over the nations.

22.a:
How can those who sleep in the earth
    bow down in worship,  ♦
22.b: or those who go down to the dust kneel before him?

22.a:
He has saved my life for himself;
    my descendants shall serve him;  ♦
22.b: this shall be told of the Lord for generations to come.

22.a:
They shall come and make known his salvation,
    to a people yet unborn,  ♦
22.b: declaring that he, the Lord, has done it.

23.a: He makes me lie down in green pastures  ♦
23.b: and leads me beside still waters.
and guide me in the paths of righteousness for his name’s sake.

23.a:
Though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death,
    I will fear no evil;  ♦
23.b:
for you are with me;
    your rod and your staff, they comfort me.

23.a:
You spread a table before me
    in the presence of those who trouble me;  ♦
23.b:
you have anointed my head with oil
    and my cup shall be full.

23.a:
Surely goodness and loving mercy shall follow me
    all the days of my life,  ♦
23.b: and I will dwell in the house of the Lord for ever.

24.a: The earth is the Lord’s and all that fills it,  ♦
24.b: the compass of the world and all who dwell therein.

24.a: For he has founded it upon the seas  ♦
24.b: and set it firm upon the rivers of the deep.

24.a: ‘Who shall ascend the hill of the Lord,  ♦
24.b: or who can rise up in his holy place?’

24.a: ‘Those who have clean hands and a pure heart,  ♦
24.b:
who have not lifted up their soul to an idol,
    nor sworn an oath to a lie;

24.a: ‘They shall receive a blessing from the Lord,  ♦
24.b: a just reward from the God of their salvation.’

24.a: Such is the company of those who seek him,  ♦
24.b: of those who seek your face, O God of Jacob.

24.a:
Lift up your heads, O gates;
    be lifted up, you everlasting doors;  ♦
24.b: and the King of glory shall come in.

‘The Lord, strong and mighty,
    the Lord who is mighty in battle.’

24.a:
Lift up your heads, O gates;
    be lifted up, you everlasting doors;  ♦
24.b: and the King of glory shall come in.

‘The Lord of hosts,
    he is the King of glory.’

25.a:
To you, O Lord, I lift up my soul;
    O my God, in you I trust;  ♦
25.b:
let me not be put to shame;
    let not my enemies triumph over me.

25.a: Let none who look to you be put to shame,  ♦
25.b: but let the treacherous be shamed and frustrated.

25.a: Make me to know your ways, O Lord,  ♦
25.b: and teach me your paths.

25.a: Lead me in your truth and teach me,  ♦
25.b:
for you are the God of my salvation;
    for you have I hoped all the day long.

25.a: Remember, Lord, your compassion and love,  ♦
25.b: for they are from everlasting.

25.a:
Remember not the sins of my youth
    or my transgressions,  ♦
25.b:
but think on me in your goodness, O Lord,
    according to your steadfast love.

25.a: Gracious and upright is the Lord;  ♦
25.b: therefore shall he teach sinners in the way.

25.a: He will guide the humble in doing right  ♦
25.b: and teach his way to the lowly.

25.a: All the paths of the Lord are mercy and truth  ♦
25.b: to those who keep his covenant and his testimonies.

25.a: For your name’s sake, O Lord,  ♦
25.b: be merciful to my sin, for it is great.

25.a: Who are those who fear the Lord?  ♦
25.b: Them will he teach in the way that they should choose.

25.a: Their soul shall dwell at ease  ♦
25.b: and their offspring shall inherit the land.

25.a: The hidden purpose of the Lord is for those who fear him  ♦
25.b: and he will show them his covenant.

25.a: My eyes are ever looking to the Lord,  ♦
25.b: for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.

25.a: Turn to me and be gracious to me,  ♦
25.b: for I am alone and brought very low.

25.a: The sorrows of my heart have increased;  ♦
25.b: O bring me out of my distress.

25.a: Look upon my adversity and misery  ♦
25.b: and forgive me all my sin.

25.a: Look upon my enemies, for they are many  ♦
25.b: and they bear a violent hatred against me.

25.a: O keep my soul and deliver me;  ♦
25.b: let me not be put to shame, for I have put my trust in you.

25.a: Let integrity and uprightness preserve me,  ♦
25.b: for my hope has been in you.

25.a: Deliver Israel, O God,  ♦
25.b: out of all his troubles.

26.a:
Give judgement for me, O Lord,
    for I have walked with integrity;  ♦
26.b: I have trusted in the Lord and have not faltered.

26.a: Test me, O Lord, and try me;  ♦
26.b: examine my heart and my mind.

26.a: For your love is before my eyes;  ♦
26.b: I have walked in your truth.

26.a: I have not joined the company of the false,  ♦
I hate the gathering of evildoers  ♦
26.b: and I will not sit down with the wicked.

26.a: I will wash my hands in innocence, O Lord,  ♦
26.b: that I may go about your altar,

26.a: To make heard the voice of thanksgiving  ♦
26.b: and tell of all your wonderful deeds.

26.a: Lord, I love the house of your habitation  ♦
26.b: and the place where your glory abides.

26.a: Sweep me not away with sinners,  ♦
26.b: nor my life with the bloodthirsty,

26.a: Whose hands are full of wicked schemes  ♦
26.b: and their right hand full of bribes.

26.a: As for me, I will walk with integrity;  ♦
26.b: redeem me, Lord, and be merciful to me.
in the great congregation I will bless the Lord.

27.a:
The Lord is my light and my salvation;
    whom then shall I fear?  ♦
27.b:
The Lord is the strength of my life;
    of whom then shall I be afraid?

27.a:
When the wicked, even my enemies and my foes,
    came upon me to eat up my flesh,  ♦

Though a host encamp against me,
    my heart shall not be afraid,  ♦
27.b:
and though there rise up war against me,
    yet will I put my trust in him.

27.a:
One thing have I asked of the Lord
    and that alone I seek:  ♦
27.b:
that I may dwell in the house of the Lord
    all the days of my life,

27.a: To behold the fair beauty of the Lord  ♦
27.b: and to seek his will in his temple.

27.a:
For in the day of trouble
    he shall hide me in his shelter;  ♦
27.b:
in the secret place of his dwelling shall he hide me
    and set me high upon a rock.

27.a: And now shall he lift up my head  ♦
27.b: above my enemies round about me;

27.a:
Therefore will I offer in his dwelling an oblation
    with great gladness;  ♦
27.b: I will sing and make music to the Lord.

27.a: Hear my voice, O Lord, when I call;  ♦
27.b: have mercy upon me and answer me.

27.a: My heart tells of your word, ‘Seek my face.’  ♦
27.b: Your face, Lord, will I seek.

27.a: Hide not your face from me,  ♦
27.b: nor cast your servant away in displeasure.
leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.

27.a: Though my father and my mother forsake me,  ♦
27.b: the Lord will take me up.

27.a: Teach me your way, O Lord;  ♦
27.b:
lead me on a level path,
    because of those who lie in wait for me.

27.a: Deliver me not into the will of my adversaries,  ♦
27.b:
for false witnesses have risen up against me,
    and those who breathe out violence.

27.a: I believe that I shall see the goodness of the Lord  ♦
27.b: in the land of the living.

27.a:
Wait for the Lord;
    be strong and he shall comfort your heart;  ♦

28.a:
To you I call, O Lord my rock;
    be not deaf to my cry,  ♦
28.b:
lest, if you do not hear me,
    I become like those who go down to the Pit.

28.a: Hear the voice of my prayer when I cry out to you,  ♦
28.b: when I lift up my hands to your holy of holies.

28.a:
Do not snatch me away with the wicked,
    with the evildoers,  ♦
28.b:
who speak peaceably with their neighbours,
    while malice is in their hearts.

28.a: Repay them according to their deeds  ♦
28.b: and according to the wickedness of their devices.

28.a: Reward them according to the work of their hands  ♦
28.b: and pay them their just deserts.

28.a:
They take no heed of the Lord’s doings,
    nor of the works of his hands;  ♦
28.b:
therefore shall he break them down
    and not build them up.
for he has heard the voice of my prayer.

28.a: The Lord is my strength and my shield;  ♦
28.b: my heart has trusted in him and I am helped;

28.a: Therefore my heart dances for joy  ♦
28.b: and in my song will I praise him.

28.a: The Lord is the strength of his people,  ♦
28.b: a safe refuge for his anointed.

28.a: Save your people and bless your inheritance;  ♦
28.b: shepherd them and carry them for ever.

29.a: Ascribe to the Lord, you powers of heaven,  ♦
29.b: ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.

29.a: Ascribe to the Lord the honour due to his name;  ♦
29.b: worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness.

29.a:
The voice of the Lord is upon the waters;
    the God of glory thunders;  ♦
29.b: the Lord is upon the mighty waters.

29.a: The voice of the Lord is mighty in operation;  ♦
29.b: the voice of the Lord is a glorious voice.

29.a: The voice of the Lord breaks the cedar trees;  ♦
29.b: the Lord breaks the cedars of Lebanon;

29.a: He makes Lebanon skip like a calf  ♦
29.b: and Sirion like a young wild ox.

29.a:
The voice of the Lord splits the flash of lightning;
    the voice of the Lord shakes the wilderness;  ♦
29.b: the Lord shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.

29.a:
The voice of the Lord makes the oak trees writhe
    and strips the forests bare;  ♦
The Lord sits enthroned above the water flood;  ♦
29.b: the Lord sits enthroned as king for evermore.

29.a: The Lord shall give strength to his people;  ♦
29.b: the Lord shall give his people the blessing of peace.

30.a:
I will exalt you, O Lord,
    because you have raised me up  ♦
30.b: and have not let my foes triumph over me.

30.a: O Lord my God, I cried out to you  ♦
You brought me up, O Lord, from the dead;  ♦
30.b: you restored me to life from among those that go down to the Pit.

30.a: Sing to the Lord, you servants of his;  ♦
30.b: give thanks to his holy name.

30.a:
For his wrath endures but the twinkling of an eye,
    his favour for a lifetime.  ♦
30.b:
Heaviness may endure for a night,
    but joy comes in the morning.

30.a:
In my prosperity I said,
    ‘I shall never be moved.  ♦
30.b:
You, Lord, of your goodness,
    have made my hill so strong.’

30.a: Then you hid your face from me  ♦
To you, O Lord, I cried;  ♦
30.b: to the Lord I made my supplication:

30.a:
‘What profit is there in my blood,
    if I go down to the Pit?  ♦
30.b: Will the dust praise you or declare your faithfulness?

30.a: ‘Hear, O Lord, and have mercy upon me;  ♦
You have turned my mourning into dancing;  ♦
30.b: you have put off my sackcloth and girded me with gladness;

30.a: Therefore my heart sings to you without ceasing;  ♦
30.b: O Lord my God, I will give you thanks for ever.

31.a:
In you, O Lord, have I taken refuge;
    let me never be put to shame;  ♦
31.b: deliver me in your righteousness.

31.a: Incline your ear to me;  ♦
31.b: make haste to deliver me.

31.a:
Be my strong rock, a fortress to save me,
    for you are my rock and my stronghold;  ♦
31.b: guide me, and lead me for your name’s sake.

31.a:
Take me out of the net
    that they have laid secretly for me,  ♦
31.b: for you are my strength.

31.a: Into your hands I commend my spirit,  ♦
31.b: for you have redeemed me, O Lord God of truth.

31.a: I hate those who cling to worthless idols;  ♦
31.b: I put my trust in the Lord.

31.a: I will be glad and rejoice in your mercy,  ♦
31.b:
for you have seen my affliction
    and known my soul in adversity.

31.a: You have not shut me up in the hand of the enemy;  ♦
31.b: you have set my feet in an open place.

31.a: Have mercy on me, Lord, for I am in trouble;  ♦
31.b:
my eye is consumed with sorrow,
    my soul and my body also.

31.a:
For my life is wasted with grief,
    and my years with sighing;  ♦
31.b:
my strength fails me because of my affliction,
    and my bones are consumed.

31.a:
I have become a reproach to all my enemies
    and even to my neighbours,
    an object of dread to my acquaintances;  ♦
31.b: when they see me in the street they flee from me.

31.a: I am forgotten like one that is dead, out of mind;  ♦
31.b: I have become like a broken vessel.

31.a:
For I have heard the whispering of the crowd;
    fear is on every side;  ♦
31.b:
they scheme together against me,
    and plot to take my life.

31.a: But my trust is in you, O Lord.  ♦
31.b: I have said, ‘You are my God.

31.a: ‘My times are in your hand;  ♦
31.b:
deliver me from the hand of my enemies,
    and from those who persecute me.

31.a: ‘Make your face to shine upon your servant,  ♦
31.b: and save me for your mercy’s sake.’

31.a:
Lord, let me not be confounded
    for I have called upon you;  ♦
31.b:
but let the wicked be put to shame;
    let them be silent in the grave.

31.a: Let the lying lips be put to silence  ♦
31.b:
that speak against the righteous
    with arrogance, disdain and contempt.

31.a:
How abundant is your goodness, O Lord,
    which you have laid up for those who fear you;  ♦
31.b:
which you have prepared in the sight of all
    for those who put their trust in you.

31.a:
You hide them in the shelter of your presence
    from those who slander them;  ♦
31.b: you keep them safe in your refuge from the strife of tongues.

31.a: Blessed be the Lord!  ♦
31.b:
For he has shown me his steadfast love
    when I was as a city besieged.

31.a:
I had said in my alarm,
    ‘I have been cut off from the sight of your eyes.’  ♦
31.b:
Nevertheless, you heard the voice of my prayer
    when I cried out to you.

31.a: Love the Lord, all you his servants;  ♦
31.b:
for the Lord protects the faithful,
    but repays to the full the proud.

31.a: Be strong and let your heart take courage,  ♦
31.b: all you who wait in hope for the Lord.

32.a: Happy the one whose transgression is forgiven,  ♦
Happy the one to whom the Lord imputes no guilt,  ♦
32.b: and in whose spirit there is no guile.

my bones wasted away
    through my groaning all the day long.

32.a: Your hand was heavy upon me day and night;  ♦
32.b: my moisture was dried up like the drought in summer.

32.a: Then I acknowledged my sin to you  ♦
32.b: and my iniquity I did not hide.

32.a: I said, ‘I will confess my transgressions to the Lord,’  ♦
32.b: and you forgave the guilt of my sin.

32.a:
Therefore let all the faithful make their prayers to you
    in time of trouble;  ♦
32.b: in the great water flood, it shall not reach them.

32.a:
You are a place for me to hide in;
    you preserve me from trouble;  ♦
32.b: you surround me with songs of deliverance.

32.a:
‘I will instruct you and teach you
    in the way that you should go;  ♦
32.b: I will guide you with my eye.

32.a: ‘Be not like horse and mule which have no understanding;  ♦
32.b:
whose mouths must be held with bit and bridle,
    or else they will not stay near you.’

32.a: Great tribulations remain for the wicked,  ♦
32.b: but mercy embraces those who trust in the Lord.

32.a: Be glad, you righteous, and rejoice in the Lord;  ♦
32.b: shout for joy, all who are true of heart.

33.a: Rejoice in the Lord, O you righteous,  ♦
33.b: for it is good for the just to sing praises.

33.a: Praise the Lord with the lyre;  ♦
33.b: on the ten-stringed harp sing his praise.

33.a: Sing for him a new song;  ♦
33.b: play skilfully, with shouts of praise.

33.a: For the word of the Lord is true  ♦
33.b: and all his works are sure.

33.a: He loves righteousness and justice;  ♦
33.b: the earth is full of the loving-kindness of the Lord.

33.a: By the word of the Lord were the heavens made  ♦
33.b: and all their host by the breath of his mouth.

33.a: He gathers up the waters of the sea as in a waterskin  ♦
33.b: and lays up the deep in his treasury.

33.a: Let all the earth fear the Lord;  ♦
33.b: stand in awe of him, all who dwell in the world.

33.a: For he spoke, and it was done;  ♦
33.b: he commanded, and it stood fast.

33.a: The Lord brings the counsel of the nations to naught;  ♦
33.b: he frustrates the designs of the peoples.

33.a: But the counsel of the Lord shall endure for ever  ♦
33.b: and the designs of his heart from generation to generation.

33.a: Happy the nation whose God is the Lord  ♦
33.b: and the people he has chosen for his own.

33.a: The Lord looks down from heaven  ♦
33.b: and beholds all the children of earth.

33.a: From where he sits enthroned he turns his gaze  ♦
33.b: on all who dwell on the earth.

33.a: He fashions all the hearts of them  ♦
33.b: and understands all their works.

33.a: No king is saved by the might of his host;  ♦
33.b: no warrior delivered by his great strength.

33.a: A horse is a vain hope for deliverance;  ♦
33.b: for all its strength it cannot save.

33.a:
Behold, the eye of the Lord
    is upon those who fear him,  ♦
33.b: on those who wait in hope for his steadfast love,

33.a: To deliver their soul from death  ♦
33.b: and to feed them in time of famine.

33.a: Our soul waits longingly for the Lord;  ♦
33.b: he is our help and our shield.

33.a: Indeed, our heart rejoices in him;  ♦
33.b: in his holy name have we put our trust.

33.a: Let your loving-kindness, O Lord, be upon us,  ♦
33.b: as we have set our hope on you.

34.a: I will bless the Lord at all times;  ♦
34.b: his praise shall ever be in my mouth.

34.a: My soul shall glory in the Lord;  ♦
34.b: let the humble hear and be glad.

34.a: O magnify the Lord with me;  ♦
34.b: let us exalt his name together.

34.a: I sought the Lord and he answered me  ♦
34.b: and delivered me from all my fears.

34.a: Look upon him and be radiant  ♦
34.b: and your faces shall not be ashamed.

34.a: This poor soul cried, and the Lord heard me  ♦
34.b: and saved me from all my troubles.

34.a: The angel of the Lord encamps around those who fear him  ♦
34.b: and delivers them.

34.a: O taste and see that the Lord is gracious;  ♦
34.b: blessed is the one who trusts in him.

34.a: Fear the Lord, all you his holy ones,  ♦
34.b: for those who fear him lack nothing.

34.a: Lions may lack and suffer hunger,  ♦
34.b:
but those who seek the Lord
    lack nothing that is good.

34.a: Come, my children, and listen to me;  ♦
34.b: I will teach you the fear of the Lord.

34.a: Who is there who delights in life  ♦
34.b: and longs for days to enjoy good things?

34.a: Keep your tongue from evil  ♦
34.b: and your lips from lying words.

34.a: Turn from evil and do good;  ♦
34.b: seek peace and pursue it.

34.a: The eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous  ♦
34.b: and his ears are open to their cry.

34.a: The face of the Lord is against those who do evil,  ♦
34.b: to root out the remembrance of them from the earth.

34.a: The righteous cry and the Lord hears them  ♦
34.b: and delivers them out of all their troubles.

34.a: The Lord is near to the brokenhearted  ♦
34.b: and will save those who are crushed in spirit.

34.a: Many are the troubles of the righteous;  ♦
34.b: from them all will the Lord deliver them.

34.a: He keeps all their bones,  ♦
34.b: so that not one of them is broken.

34.a: But evil shall slay the wicked  ♦
34.b: and those who hate the righteous will be condemned.

34.a: The Lord ransoms the life of his servants  ♦
34.b: and will condemn none who seek refuge in him.

35.a: Contend, O Lord, with those that contend with me;  ♦
35.b: fight against those that fight against me.

35.a: Take up shield and buckler  ♦
35.b: and rise up to help me.

35.a:
Draw the spear and bar the way
    against those who pursue me;  ♦
35.b: say to my soul, ‘I am your salvation.’

35.a: Let those who seek after my life be shamed and disgraced;  ♦
35.b: let those who plot my ruin fall back and be put to confusion.

35.a: Let them be as chaff before the wind,  ♦
35.b: with the angel of the Lord thrusting them down.

35.a: Let their way be dark and slippery,  ♦
35.b: with the angel of the Lord pursuing them.

35.a: For they have secretly spread a net for me without a cause;  ♦
35.b: without any cause they have dug a pit for my soul.

35.a: Let ruin come upon them unawares;  ♦
35.b:
let them be caught in the net they laid;
    let them fall in it to their destruction.

35.a: Then will my soul be joyful in the Lord  ♦
35.b: and glory in his salvation.

35.a: My very bones will say, ‘Lord, who is like you?  ♦
35.b:
You deliver the poor from those that are too strong for them,
    the poor and needy from those who would despoil them.’

35.a: False witnesses rose up against me;  ♦
35.b: they charged me with things I knew not.

35.a: They rewarded me evil for good,  ♦
35.b: to the desolation of my soul.

35.a: But as for me, when they were sick I put on sackcloth  ♦
35.b: and humbled myself with fasting;

35.a: When my prayer returned empty to my bosom,  ♦
35.b: it was as though I grieved for my friend or brother;

35.a: I behaved as one who mourns for his mother,  ♦
35.b: bowed down and brought very low.

35.a:
But when I stumbled, they gathered in delight;
    they gathered together against me;  ♦
35.b:
as if they were strangers I did not know
    they tore at me without ceasing.

35.a: When I fell they mocked me;  ♦
35.b: they gnashed at me with their teeth.

35.a: O Lord, how long will you look on?  ♦
35.b:
Rescue my soul from their ravages,
    and my poor life from the young lions.

35.a: I will give you thanks in the great congregation;  ♦
35.b: I will praise you in the mighty throng.

35.a: Do not let my treacherous foes rejoice over me,  ♦
35.b:
or those who hate me without a cause
    mock me with their glances.

35.a: For they do not speak of peace,  ♦
35.b: but invent deceitful schemes against those that are quiet in the land.

35.a: They opened wide their mouths and derided me, saying  ♦
35.b: ‘We have seen it with our very eyes.’

35.a: This you have seen, O Lord; do not keep silent;  ♦
35.b: go not far from me, O Lord.

35.a: Awake, arise, to my cause,  ♦
35.b: to my defence, my God and my Lord!

35.a:
Give me justice, O Lord my God,
    according to your righteousness;  ♦
35.b: let them not triumph over me.

35.a:
Let them not say to themselves,
    ‘Our heart’s desire!’  ♦
35.b: Let them not say, ‘We have swallowed him up.’

35.a: Let all who rejoice at my trouble be put to shame and confusion;  ♦
35.b:
let those who boast against me
    be clothed with shame and dishonour.

35.a: Let those who favour my cause rejoice and be glad;  ♦
35.b:
let them say always,
    ‘Great is the Lord, who delights in his servant’s well-being.’

35.a: So shall my tongue be talking of your righteousness  ♦
35.b: and of your praise all the day long.

36.a: Sin whispers to the wicked, in the depths of their heart;  ♦
36.b: there is no fear of God before their eyes.

36.a: They flatter themselves in their own eyes  ♦
36.b: that their abominable sin will not be found out.

36.a: The words of their mouth are unrighteous and full of deceit;  ♦
36.b: they have ceased to act wisely and to do good.

36.a:
They think out mischief upon their beds
    and have set themselves in no good way;  ♦
36.b: nor do they abhor that which is evil.

36.a: Your love, O Lord, reaches to the heavens  ♦
36.b: and your faithfulness to the clouds.

36.a:
Your righteousness stands like the strong mountains,
    your justice like the great deep;  ♦
36.b: you, Lord, shall save both man and beast.

36.a: How precious is your loving mercy, O God!  ♦
36.b:
All mortal flesh shall take refuge
    under the shadow of your wings.

36.a: They shall be satisfied with the abundance of your house;  ♦
36.b: they shall drink from the river of your delights.

36.a: For with you is the well of life  ♦
36.b: and in your light shall we see light.

36.a: O continue your loving-kindness to those who know you  ♦
36.b: and your righteousness to those who are true of heart.

36.a: Let not the foot of pride come against me,  ♦
36.b: nor the hand of the ungodly thrust me away.

36.a: There are they fallen, all who work wickedness.  ♦
36.b: They are cast down and shall not be able to stand.

37.a: Fret not because of evildoers;  ♦
37.b: be not jealous of those who do wrong.

37.a: For they shall soon wither like grass  ♦
37.b: and like the green herb fade away.

37.a: Trust in the Lord and be doing good;  ♦
37.b: dwell in the land and be nourished with truth.

37.a: Let your delight be in the Lord  ♦
37.b: and he will give you your heart’s desire.

37.a: Commit your way to the Lord and put your trust in him,  ♦
37.b: and he will bring it to pass.

37.a: He will make your righteousness as clear as the light  ♦
37.b: and your just dealing as the noonday.

37.a: Be still before the Lord and wait for him;  ♦
37.b:
do not fret over those that prosper
    as they follow their evil schemes.

37.a: Refrain from anger and abandon wrath;  ♦
37.b: do not fret, lest you be moved to do evil.

37.a: For evildoers shall be cut off,  ♦
37.b: but those who wait upon the Lord shall possess the land.

37.a: Yet a little while and the wicked shall be no more;  ♦
37.b: you will search for their place and find them gone.

37.a: But the lowly shall possess the land  ♦
37.b: and shall delight in abundance of peace.

37.a: The wicked plot against the righteous  ♦
37.b: and gnash at them with their teeth.

37.a: The Lord shall laugh at the wicked,  ♦
37.b: for he sees that their day is coming.

37.a:
The wicked draw their sword and bend their bow
    to strike down the poor and needy,  ♦
37.b: to slaughter those who walk in truth.

37.a: Their sword shall go through their own heart  ♦
37.b: and their bows shall be broken.

37.a: The little that the righteous have  ♦
37.b: is better than great riches of the wicked.

37.a: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken,  ♦
37.b: but the Lord upholds the righteous.

37.a: The Lord knows the days of the godly,  ♦
37.b: and their inheritance shall stand for ever.

37.a: They shall not be put to shame in the perilous time,  ♦
37.b: and in days of famine they shall have enough.
they shall vanish like smoke.

37.a: The wicked borrow and do not repay,  ♦
37.b: but the righteous are generous in giving.

37.a: For those who are blest by God shall possess the land,  ♦
37.b: but those who are cursed by him shall be rooted out.

37.a: When your steps are guided by the Lord  ♦
37.b: and you delight in his way,

37.a: Though you stumble, you shall not fall headlong,  ♦
37.b: for the Lord holds you fast by the hand.

37.a: I have been young and now am old,  ♦
37.b:
yet never have I seen the righteous forsaken,
    or their children begging their bread.

37.a: All the day long they are generous in lending,  ♦
37.b: and their children also shall be blest.

37.a: Depart from evil and do good  ♦
37.b: and you shall abide for ever.

37.a: For the Lord loves the thing that is right  ♦
37.b: and will not forsake his faithful ones.

37.a: The unjust shall be destroyed for ever,  ♦
37.b: and the offspring of the wicked shall be rooted out.

37.a: The righteous shall possess the land  ♦
37.b: and dwell in it for ever.

37.a: The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom,  ♦
37.b: and their tongue speaks the thing that is right.

37.a: The law of their God is in their heart  ♦
37.b: and their footsteps shall not slide.

37.a: The wicked spy on the righteous  ♦
37.b: and seek occasion to slay them.

37.a: The Lord will not leave them in their hand,  ♦
37.b: nor let them be condemned when they are judged.

37.a: Wait upon the Lord and keep his way;  ♦
37.b:
he will raise you up to possess the land,
    and when the wicked are uprooted, you shall see it.

37.a: I myself have seen the wicked in great power  ♦
37.b: and flourishing like a tree in full leaf.

37.a: I went by and lo, they were gone;  ♦
37.b: I sought them, but they could nowhere be found.

37.a: Keep innocence and heed the thing that is right,  ♦
37.b: for that will bring you peace at the last.

37.a: But the sinners shall perish together,  ♦
37.b: and the posterity of the wicked shall be rooted out.

37.a: The salvation of the righteous comes from the Lord;  ♦
37.b: he is their stronghold in the time of trouble.

37.a: The Lord shall stand by them and deliver them;  ♦
37.b:
he shall deliver them from the wicked and shall save them,
    because they have put their trust in him.

38.a: Rebuke me not, O Lord, in your anger,  ♦
38.b: neither chasten me in your heavy displeasure.

38.a: For your arrows have stuck fast in me  ♦
38.b: and your hand presses hard upon me.

38.a:
There is no health in my flesh
    because of your indignation;  ♦
38.b: there is no peace in my bones because of my sin.

38.a: For my iniquities have gone over my head;  ♦
38.b: their weight is a burden too heavy to bear.

38.a: My wounds stink and fester  ♦
38.b: because of my foolishness.

38.a: I am utterly bowed down and brought very low;  ♦
38.b: I go about mourning all the day long.

38.a: My loins are filled with searing pain;  ♦
38.b: there is no health in my flesh.

38.a: I am feeble and utterly crushed;  ♦
38.b: I roar aloud because of the disquiet of my heart.

38.a: O Lord, you know all my desires  ♦
38.b: and my sighing is not hidden from you.

38.a: My heart is pounding, my strength has failed me;  ♦
38.b: the light of my eyes is gone from me.

38.a: My friends and companions stand apart from my affliction;  ♦
38.b: my neighbours stand afar off.

38.a: Those who seek after my life lay snares for me;  ♦
38.b:
and those who would harm me whisper evil
    and mutter slander all the day long.

38.a: But I am like one who is deaf and hears not,  ♦
38.b: like one that is dumb, who does not open his mouth.

38.a: I have become like one who does not hear  ♦
38.b: and from whose mouth comes no retort.

38.a: For in you, Lord, have I put my trust;  ♦
38.b: you will answer me, O Lord my God.

38.a: For I said, ‘Let them not triumph over me,  ♦
38.b: those who exult over me when my foot slips.’

38.a: Truly, I am on the verge of falling  ♦
38.b: and my pain is ever with me.

38.a: I will confess my iniquity  ♦
38.b: and be sorry for my sin.

38.a: Those that are my enemies without any cause are mighty,  ♦
38.b: and those who hate me wrongfully are many in number.

38.a: Those who repay evil for good are against me,  ♦
38.b: because the good is what I seek.

38.a: Forsake me not, O Lord;  ♦
38.b: be not far from me, O my God.

38.a: Make haste to help me,  ♦
38.b: O Lord of my salvation.

39.a: I said, ‘I will keep watch over my ways,  ♦
39.b: so that I offend not with my tongue.

39.a: ‘I will guard my mouth with a muzzle,  ♦
39.b: while the wicked are in my sight.’

39.a: So I held my tongue and said nothing;  ♦
39.b: I kept silent but to no avail.

39.a: My distress increased, my heart grew hot within me;  ♦
39.b:
while I mused, the fire was kindled
    and I spoke out with my tongue:

39.a: ‘Lord, let me know my end and the number of my days,  ♦
39.b: that I may know how short my time is.

39.a:
‘You have made my days but a handsbreadth,
    and my lifetime is as nothing in your sight;  ♦
39.b: truly, even those who stand upright are but a breath.

39.a:
‘We walk about like a shadow
    and in vain we are in turmoil;  ♦
39.b: we heap up riches and cannot tell who will gather them.
Truly my hope is even in you.
and do not make me the taunt of the fool.’

39.a: I fell silent and did not open my mouth,  ♦
39.b: for surely it was your doing.

39.a: Take away your plague from me;  ♦
39.b: I am consumed by the blows of your hand.

39.a:
With rebukes for sin you punish us;
    like a moth you consume our beauty;  ♦
39.b: truly, everyone is but a breath.

39.a: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and give ear to my cry;  ♦
39.b: hold not your peace at my tears.

39.a: For I am but a stranger with you,  ♦
39.b: a wayfarer, as all my forebears were.

39.a: Turn your gaze from me, that I may be glad again,  ♦
39.b: before I go my way and am no more.

40.a: I waited patiently for the Lord;  ♦
40.b: he inclined to me and heard my cry.

40.a:
He brought me out of the roaring pit,
    out of the mire and clay;  ♦
40.b: he set my feet upon a rock and made my footing sure.

40.a:
He has put a new song in my mouth,
    a song of praise to our God;  ♦
40.b:
many shall see and fear
    and put their trust in the Lord.

40.a: Blessed is the one who trusts in the Lord,  ♦
40.b: who does not turn to the proud that follow a lie.

40.a:
Great are the wonders you have done, O Lord my God.
    How great your designs for us!  ♦
40.b: There is none that can be compared with you.

40.a: If I were to proclaim them and tell of them  ♦
40.b: they would be more than I am able to express.

40.a: Sacrifice and offering you do not desire  ♦
40.b: but my ears you have opened;

40.a: Burnt offering and sacrifice for sin you have not required;  ♦

‘In the scroll of the book it is written of me
    that I should do your will, O my God;  ♦
40.b: I delight to do it: your law is within my heart.’

40.a: I have declared your righteousness in the great congregation;  ♦
40.b:
behold, I did not restrain my lips,
    and that, O Lord, you know.

40.a:
Your righteousness I have not hidden in my heart;
    I have spoken of your faithfulness and your salvation;  ♦
40.b:
I have not concealed your loving-kindness and truth
    from the great congregation.

40.a: Do not withhold your compassion from me, O Lord;  ♦
40.b: let your love and your faithfulness always preserve me,

40.a:
For innumerable troubles have come about me;
    my sins have overtaken me so that I cannot look up;  ♦
40.b:
they are more in number than the hairs of my head,
    and my heart fails me.

40.a: Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me;  ♦
40.b: O Lord, make haste to help me.

40.a:
Let them be ashamed and altogether dismayed
    who seek after my life to destroy it;  ♦
40.b:
let them be driven back and put to shame
    who wish me evil.

40.a: Let those who heap insults upon me  ♦
40.b: be desolate because of their shame.

40.a: Let all who seek you rejoice in you and be glad;  ♦
40.b:
let those who love your salvation say always,
    ‘The Lord is great.’

40.a: Though I am poor and needy,  ♦
You are my helper and my deliverer;  ♦
40.b: O my God, make no delay.

41.a: Blessed are those who consider the poor and needy;  ♦
41.b: the Lord will deliver them in the time of trouble.

41.a:
The Lord preserves them and restores their life,
    that they may be happy in the land;  ♦
41.b: he will not hand them over to the will of their enemies.

41.a: The Lord sustains them on their sickbed;  ♦
41.b: their sickness, Lord, you will remove.

41.a: And so I said, ‘Lord, be merciful to me;  ♦
41.b: heal me, for I have sinned against you.’

41.a: My enemies speak evil about me,  ♦
41.b: asking when I shall die and my name perish.

41.a: If they come to see me, they utter empty words;  ♦
41.b:
their heart gathers mischief;
    when they go out, they tell it abroad.

41.a: All my enemies whisper together against me,  ♦
Saying that a deadly thing has laid hold on me,  ♦
41.b: and that I will not rise again from where I lie.

41.a:
Even my bosom friend, whom I trusted,
    who ate of my bread,  ♦
41.b: has lifted up his heel against me.

41.a: But you, O Lord, be merciful to me  ♦
41.b: and raise me up, that I may reward them.

41.a: By this I know that you favour me,  ♦
41.b: that my enemy does not triumph over me.

41.a: Because of my integrity you uphold me  ♦
41.b: and will set me before your face for ever.

41.a: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel,  ♦
41.b: from everlasting to everlasting. Amen and Amen.

42.a: As the deer longs for the water brooks,  ♦
42.b: so longs my soul for you, O God.

42.a: My soul is athirst for God, even for the living God;  ♦
42.b: when shall I come before the presence of God?

42.a: My tears have been my bread day and night,  ♦
42.b: while all day long they say to me, ‘Where is now your God?’

42.a: Now when I think on these things, I pour out my soul:  ♦
42.b:
how I went with the multitude
    and led the procession to the house of God,

42.a: With the voice of praise and thanksgiving,  ♦
42.b: among those who kept holy day.

42.a: Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul,  ♦
42.b: and why are you so disquieted within me?

42.a: O put your trust in God;  ♦
42.b:
for I will yet give him thanks,
    who is the help of my countenance, and my God.

42.a: My soul is heavy within me;  ♦
42.b:
therefore I will remember you from the land of Jordan,
    and from Hermon and the hill of Mizar.

42.a: Deep calls to deep in the thunder of your waterfalls;  ♦
42.b: all your breakers and waves have gone over me.

42.a: The Lord will grant his loving-kindness in the daytime;  ♦
42.b:
through the night his song will be with me,
    a prayer to the God of my life.

42.a:
I say to God my rock,
    ‘Why have you forgotten me,  ♦
42.b: and why go I so heavily, while the enemy oppresses me?’

42.a: As they crush my bones, my enemies mock me;  ♦
42.b: while all day long they say to me, ‘Where is now your God?’

42.a: Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul,  ♦
42.b: and why are you so disquieted within me?

42.a: O put your trust in God;  ♦
42.b:
for I will yet give him thanks,
    who is the help of my countenance, and my God.

43.a:
Give judgement for me, O God,
    and defend my cause against an ungodly people;  ♦
43.b: deliver me from the deceitful and the wicked.

43.a:
For you are the God of my refuge;
    why have you cast me from you,  ♦
43.b: and why go I so heavily, while the enemy oppresses me?

43.a: O send out your light and your truth, that they may lead me,  ♦
43.b: and bring me to your holy hill and to your dwelling,

43.a:
That I may go to the altar of God,
    to the God of my joy and gladness;  ♦
43.b: and on the lyre I will give thanks to you, O God my God.

43.a: Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul,  ♦
43.b: and why are you so disquieted within me?

43.a: O put your trust in God;  ♦
43.b:
for I will yet give him thanks,
    who is the help of my countenance, and my God.

44.a: We have heard with our ears, O God, our forebears have told us,  ♦
44.b: all that you did in their days, in time of old;

44.a: How with your hand you drove out nations and planted us in,  ♦
44.b: and broke the power of peoples and set us free.

44.a: For not by their own sword did our ancestors take the land  ♦
44.b: nor did their own arm save them,

44.a: But your right hand, your arm, and the light of your countenance,  ♦
44.b: because you were gracious to them.

44.a: You are my King and my God,  ♦
44.b: who commanded salvation for Jacob.

44.a: Through you we drove back our adversaries;  ♦
44.b: through your name we trod down our foes.

44.a: For I did not trust in my bow;  ♦
44.b: it was not my own sword that saved me;

44.a: It was you that saved us from our enemies  ♦
44.b: and put our adversaries to shame.

44.a: We gloried in God all the day long,  ♦
44.b: and were ever praising your name.

44.a: But now you have rejected us and brought us to shame,  ♦
44.b: and go not out with our armies.

44.a: You have made us turn our backs on our enemies,  ♦
44.b: and our enemies have despoiled us.

44.a: You have made us like sheep to be slaughtered,  ♦
44.b: and have scattered us among the nations.

44.a: You have sold your people for a pittance  ♦
44.b: and made no profit on their sale.

44.a: You have made us the taunt of our neighbours,  ♦
44.b: the scorn and derision of those that are round about us.

44.a: You have made us a byword among the nations;  ♦
44.b: among the peoples they wag their heads.

44.a: My confusion is daily before me,  ♦
44.b: and shame has covered my face,

44.a: At the taunts of the slanderer and reviler,  ♦
44.b: at the sight of the enemy and avenger.

44.a:
All this has come upon us,
    though we have not forgotten you  ♦
44.b: and have not played false to your covenant.

44.a: Our hearts have not turned back,  ♦
44.b: nor our steps gone out of your way,

44.a: Yet you have crushed us in the haunt of jackals,  ♦
44.b: and covered us with the shadow of death.

44.a: If we have forgotten the name of our God,  ♦
44.b: or stretched out our hands to any strange god,

44.a: Will not God search it out?  ♦
44.b: For he knows the secrets of the heart.

44.a: But for your sake are we killed all the day long,  ♦
44.b: and are counted as sheep for the slaughter.

44.a: Rise up! Why sleep, O Lord?  ♦
44.b: Awake, and do not reject us for ever.

44.a: Why do you hide your face  ♦
44.b: and forget our grief and oppression?

44.a: Our soul is bowed down to the dust;  ♦
44.b: our belly cleaves to the earth.

44.a: Rise up, O Lord, to help us  ♦
44.b: and redeem us for the sake of your steadfast love.

45.a: My heart is astir with gracious words;  ♦
45.b:
as I make my song for the king,
    my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

45.a: You are the fairest of men;  ♦
45.b:
full of grace are your lips,
    for God has blest you for ever.

45.a: Gird your sword upon your thigh, O mighty one;  ♦
45.b: gird on your majesty and glory.

45.a: Ride on and prosper in the cause of truth  ♦
45.b: and for the sake of humility and righteousness.

45.a: Your right hand will teach you terrible things;  ♦
45.b:
your arrows will be sharp in the heart of the king’s enemies,
    so that peoples fall beneath you.

45.a: Your throne is God’s throne, for ever;  ♦
45.b: the sceptre of your kingdom is the sceptre of righteousness.

45.a: You love righteousness and hate iniquity;  ♦
45.b:
therefore God, your God, has anointed you
    with the oil of gladness above your fellows.

45.a: All your garments are fragrant with myrrh, aloes and cassia;  ♦
45.b: from ivory palaces the music of strings makes you glad.

45.a: Kings’ daughters are among your honourable women;  ♦
45.b: at your right hand stands the queen in gold of Ophir.

45.a: Hear, O daughter; consider and incline your ear;  ♦
45.b: forget your own people and your father’s house.

45.a: So shall the king have pleasure in your beauty;  ♦
45.b: he is your lord, so do him honour.

45.a: The people of Tyre shall bring you gifts;  ♦
45.b: the richest of the people shall seek your favour.

45.a: The king’s daughter is all glorious within;  ♦
45.b: her clothing is embroidered cloth of gold.

45.a: She shall be brought to the king in raiment of needlework;  ♦
45.b: after her the virgins that are her companions.

45.a: With joy and gladness shall they be brought  ♦
45.b: and enter into the palace of the king.

45.a: ‘Instead of your fathers you shall have sons,  ♦
45.b: whom you shall make princes over all the land.

45.a: ‘I will make your name to be remembered through all generations;  ♦
45.b: therefore shall the peoples praise you for ever and ever.’

46.a: God is our refuge and strength,  ♦
46.b: a very present help in trouble;

46.a: Therefore we will not fear, though the earth be moved,  ♦
46.b: and though the mountains tremble in the heart of the sea;

46.a: Though the waters rage and swell,  ♦
46.b: and though the mountains quake at the towering seas.

46.a: There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God,  ♦
46.b: the holy place of the dwelling of the Most High.

46.a:
God is in the midst of her;
    therefore shall she not be removed;  ♦
46.b: God shall help her at the break of day.

46.a: The nations are in uproar and the kingdoms are shaken,  ♦
46.b: but God utters his voice and the earth shall melt away.

46.a: The Lord of hosts is with us;  ♦
46.b: the God of Jacob is our stronghold.

46.a: Come and behold the works of the Lord,  ♦
46.b: what destruction he has wrought upon the earth.

46.a: He makes wars to cease in all the world;  ♦
46.b:
he shatters the bow and snaps the spear
    and burns the chariots in the fire.

46.a: ‘Be still, and know that I am God;  ♦
46.b:
I will be exalted among the nations;
    I will be exalted in the earth.’

46.a: The Lord of hosts is with us;  ♦
46.b: the God of Jacob is our stronghold.

47.a: Clap your hands together, all you peoples;  ♦
47.b: O sing to God with shouts of joy.

47.a: For the Lord Most High is to be feared;  ♦
47.b: he is the great King over all the earth.

47.a: He subdued the peoples under us  ♦
47.b: and the nations under our feet.

47.a: He has chosen our heritage for us,  ♦
47.b: the pride of Jacob, whom he loves.

47.a: God has gone up with a merry noise,  ♦
47.b: the Lord with the sound of the trumpet.

47.a: O sing praises to God, sing praises;  ♦
47.b: sing praises to our King, sing praises.

47.a: For God is the King of all the earth;  ♦
47.b: sing praises with all your skill.
God has taken his seat upon his holy throne.

47.a: The nobles of the peoples are gathered together  ♦
47.b: with the people of the God of Abraham.

47.a: For the powers of the earth belong to God  ♦
47.b: and he is very highly exalted.

48.a: Great is the Lord and highly to be praised,  ♦
48.b: in the city of our God.

48.a: His holy mountain is fair and lifted high,  ♦
48.b: the joy of all the earth.

48.a: On Mount Zion, the divine dwelling place,  ♦
48.b: stands the city of the great king.

48.a: In her palaces God has shown himself  ♦
For behold, the kings of the earth assembled  ♦

Trembling seized them there;
    they writhed like a woman in labour,  ♦
48.b: as when the east wind shatters the ships of Tarshish.

48.a:
As we had heard, so have we seen
    in the city of the Lord of hosts, the city of our God:  ♦
48.b: God has established her for ever.

48.a: We have waited on your loving-kindness, O God,  ♦
48.b: in the midst of your temple.

48.a:
As with your name, O God,
    so your praise reaches to the ends of the earth;  ♦
48.b: your right hand is full of justice.

48.a: Let Mount Zion rejoice and the daughters of Judah be glad,  ♦
48.b: because of your judgements, O Lord.

48.a:
Walk about Zion and go round about her;
    count all her towers;  ♦
48.b: consider well her bulwarks; pass through her citadels,

48.a:
That you may tell those who come after
    that such is our God for ever and ever.  ♦
48.b: It is he that shall be our guide for evermore.

49.a: Hear this, all you peoples;  ♦
49.b: listen, all you that dwell in the world,

49.a: You of low or high degree,  ♦
49.b: both rich and poor together.

49.a: My mouth shall speak of wisdom  ♦
49.b: and my heart shall meditate on understanding.

49.a: I will incline my ear to a parable;  ♦
49.b: I will unfold my riddle with the lyre.

49.a: Why should I fear in evil days,  ♦
49.b: when the malice of my foes surrounds me,

49.a: Such as trust in their goods  ♦
49.b: and glory in the abundance of their riches?

49.a: For no one can indeed ransom another  ♦
49.b: or pay to God the price of deliverance.

49.a: To ransom a soul is too costly;  ♦
49.b: there is no price one could pay for it,

49.a: So that they might live for ever,  ♦
49.b: and never see the grave.

49.a:
For we see that the wise die also;
    with the foolish and ignorant they perish  ♦
49.b: and leave their riches to others.

49.a:
Their tomb is their home for ever,
    their dwelling through all generations,  ♦
49.b: though they call their lands after their own names.

49.a: Those who have honour, but lack understanding,  ♦
49.b: are like the beasts that perish.

49.a: Such is the way of those who boast in themselves,  ♦
49.b: the end of those who delight in their own words.

49.a:
Like a flock of sheep they are destined to die;
    death is their shepherd;  ♦
49.b: they go down straight to the Pit.

49.a: Their beauty shall waste away,  ♦
49.b: and the land of the dead shall be their dwelling.

49.a: But God shall ransom my soul;  ♦
49.b: from the grasp of death will he take me.

49.a: Be not afraid if some grow rich  ♦
49.b: and the glory of their house increases,

49.a: For they will carry nothing away when they die,  ♦
49.b: nor will their glory follow after them.

49.a: Though they count themselves happy while they live  ♦
49.b: and praise you for your success,

49.a: They shall enter the company of their ancestors  ♦
49.b: who will nevermore see the light.

49.a: Those who have honour, but lack understanding,  ♦
49.b: are like the beasts that perish.

50.a: The Lord, the most mighty God, has spoken  ♦
50.b: and called the world from the rising of the sun to its setting.

50.a: Out of Zion, perfect in beauty, God shines forth;  ♦
50.b: our God comes and will not keep silence.

50.a: Consuming fire goes out before him  ♦
50.b: and a mighty tempest stirs about him.

50.a: He calls the heaven above,  ♦
50.b: and the earth, that he may judge his people:

50.a: ‘Gather to me my faithful,  ♦
50.b: who have sealed my covenant with sacrifice.’

50.a: Let the heavens declare his righteousness,  ♦
50.b: for God himself is judge.

50.a: Hear, O my people, and I will speak:  ♦
50.b:
‘I will testify against you, O Israel;
    for I am God, your God.

50.a: ‘I will not reprove you for your sacrifices,  ♦
50.b: for your burnt offerings are always before me.
