50.a: ‘I will take no bull out of your house,  ♦
50.b: nor he-goat out of your folds,

50.a: ‘For all the beasts of the forest are mine,  ♦
50.b: the cattle upon a thousand hills.

50.a: ‘I know every bird of the mountains  ♦
50.b: and the insect of the field is mine.

50.a: ‘If I were hungry, I would not tell you,  ♦
50.b: for the whole world is mine and all that fills it.

50.a: ‘Do you think I eat the flesh of bulls,  ♦
50.b: or drink the blood of goats?

50.a: ‘Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving  ♦
50.b: and fulfil your vows to God Most High.

50.a: ‘Call upon me in the day of trouble;  ♦
50.b: I will deliver you and you shall honour me.’

50.a: But to the wicked, says God:  ♦
50.b:
‘Why do you recite my statutes
    and take my covenant upon your lips,

50.a: ‘Since you refuse to be disciplined  ♦
50.b: and have cast my words behind you?

50.a: ‘When you saw a thief, you made friends with him  ♦
50.b: and you threw in your lot with adulterers.

50.a: ‘You have loosed your lips for evil  ♦
50.b: and harnessed your tongue to deceit.

50.a: ‘You sit and speak evil of your brother;  ♦
50.b: you slander your own mother’s son.

50.a: ‘These things have you done, and should I keep silence?  ♦
50.b: Did you think that I am even such a one as yourself?

50.a: ‘But no, I must reprove you,  ♦
50.b: and set before your eyes the things that you have done.

50.a: ‘You that forget God, consider this well,  ♦
50.b: lest I tear you apart and there is none to deliver you.

50.a: ‘Whoever offers me the sacrifice of thanksgiving honours me  ♦
50.b:
and to those who keep my way
    will I show the salvation of God.’

51.a: Have mercy on me, O God, in your great goodness;  ♦
51.b:
according to the abundance of your compassion
    blot out my offences.

51.a: Wash me thoroughly from my wickedness  ♦
51.b: and cleanse me from my sin.

51.a: For I acknowledge my faults  ♦
51.b: and my sin is ever before me.

51.a: Against you only have I sinned  ♦
51.b: and done what is evil in your sight,

51.a: So that you are justified in your sentence  ♦
51.b: and righteous in your judgement.

51.a: I have been wicked even from my birth,  ♦
51.b: a sinner when my mother conceived me.

51.a: Behold, you desire truth deep within me  ♦
51.b:
and shall make me understand wisdom
    in the depths of my heart.

51.a: Purge me with hyssop and I shall be clean;  ♦
51.b: wash me and I shall be whiter than snow.

51.a: Make me hear of joy and gladness,  ♦
51.b: that the bones you have broken may rejoice.

51.a: Turn your face from my sins  ♦
51.b: and blot out all my misdeeds.

51.a: Make me a clean heart, O God,  ♦
51.b: and renew a right spirit within me.

51.a: Cast me not away from your presence  ♦
51.b: and take not your holy spirit from me.

51.a: Give me again the joy of your salvation  ♦
51.b: and sustain me with your gracious spirit;

51.a: Then shall I teach your ways to the wicked  ♦
51.b: and sinners shall return to you.

51.a:
Deliver me from my guilt, O God,
    the God of my salvation,  ♦
51.b: and my tongue shall sing of your righteousness.

51.a: O Lord, open my lips  ♦
51.b: and my mouth shall proclaim your praise.

51.a: For you desire no sacrifice, else I would give it;  ♦
51.b: you take no delight in burnt offerings.

51.a: The sacrifice of God is a broken spirit;  ♦
51.b: a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.

51.a: O be favourable and gracious to Zion;  ♦
51.b: build up the walls of Jerusalem.

51.a:
Then you will accept sacrifices offered in righteousness,
    the burnt offerings and oblations;  ♦
51.b: then shall they offer up bulls on your altar.

52.a: Why do you glory in evil, you tyrant,  ♦
52.b: while the goodness of God endures continually?
your tongue is like a sharpened razor.

52.a: You love evil rather than good,  ♦
52.b: falsehood rather than the word of truth.

52.a: You love all words that hurt,  ♦
Therefore God shall utterly bring you down;  ♦
52.b:
he shall take you and pluck you out of your tent
    and root you out of the land of the living.

52.a: The righteous shall see this and tremble;  ♦
52.b: they shall laugh you to scorn, and say:

52.a: ‘This is the one who did not take God for a refuge,  ♦
52.b: but trusted in great riches and relied upon wickedness.’

52.a: But I am like a spreading olive tree in the house of God;  ♦
52.b: I trust in the goodness of God for ever and ever.

52.a: I will always give thanks to you for what you have done;  ♦
52.b:
I will hope in your name,
    for your faithful ones delight in it.

53.a: The fool has said in his heart, ‘There is no God.’  ♦
53.b:
Corrupt are they, and abominable in their wickedness;
    there is no one that does good.

53.a: God has looked down from heaven upon the children of earth,  ♦
53.b: to see if there is anyone who is wise and seeks after God.

53.a:
They are all gone out of the way;
    all alike have become corrupt;  ♦
53.b: there is no one that does good, no not one.

53.a: Have they no knowledge, those evildoers,  ♦
53.b:
who eat up my people as if they ate bread,
    and do not call upon God?

53.a:
There shall they be in great fear,
    such fear as never was;  ♦
53.b: for God will scatter the bones of the ungodly.

53.a: They will be put to shame,  ♦
O that Israel’s salvation would come out of Zion!  ♦
53.b:
When God restores the fortunes of his people
    then will Jacob rejoice and Israel be glad.

54.a: Save me, O God, by your name  ♦
54.b: and vindicate me by your power.
give heed to the words of my mouth.

54.a:
For strangers have risen up against me,
    and the ruthless seek after my life;  ♦
54.b: they have not set God before them.
it is the Lord who upholds my life.

54.a: May evil rebound on those who lie in wait for me;  ♦
An offering of a free heart will I give you  ♦
54.b: and praise your name, O Lord, for it is gracious.

54.a: For he has delivered me out of all my trouble,  ♦
54.b: and my eye has seen the downfall of my enemies.

55.a: Hear my prayer, O God;  ♦
55.b: hide not yourself from my petition.

55.a: Give heed to me and answer me;  ♦
55.b: I am restless in my complaining.

55.a: I am alarmed at the voice of the enemy  ♦
55.b: and at the clamour of the wicked;

55.a: For they would bring down evil upon me  ♦
55.b: and are set against me in fury.

55.a: My heart is disquieted within me,  ♦
55.b: and the terrors of death have fallen upon me.

55.a: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me,  ♦
55.b: and a horrible dread has overwhelmed me.

55.a: And I said: ‘O that I had wings like a dove,  ♦
55.b: for then would I fly away and be at rest.

55.a: ‘Then would I flee far away  ♦
55.b: and make my lodging in the wilderness.

55.a: ‘I would make haste to escape  ♦
55.b: from the stormy wind and tempest.’

55.a: Confuse their tongues, O Lord, and divide them,  ♦
55.b: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.

55.a: Day and night they go about on her walls;  ♦
55.b: mischief and trouble are in her midst.

55.a: Wickedness walks in her streets;  ♦
55.b: oppression and guile never leave her squares.

55.a: For it was not an open enemy that reviled me,  ♦
55.b: for then I could have borne it;

55.a: Nor was it my adversary that puffed himself up against me,  ♦
55.b: for then I would have hid myself from him.

55.a: But it was even you, one like myself,  ♦
55.b: my companion and my own familiar friend.

55.a: We took sweet counsel together  ♦
55.b: and walked with the multitude in the house of God.

55.a:
Let death come suddenly upon them;
    let them go down alive to the Pit;  ♦
55.b: for wickedness inhabits their dwellings, their very hearts.

55.a: As for me, I will call upon God  ♦
55.b: and the Lord will deliver me.

55.a:
In the evening and morning and at noonday
    I will pray and make my supplication,  ♦
55.b: and he shall hear my voice.

55.a:
He shall redeem my soul in peace
    from the battle waged against me,  ♦
55.b: for many have come upon me.

55.a:
God, who is enthroned of old,
    will hear and bring them down;  ♦
55.b: they will not repent, for they have no fear of God.

55.a: My companion stretched out his hands against his friend  ♦
55.b: and has broken his covenant;

55.a: His speech was softer than butter, though war was in his heart;  ♦
55.b: his words were smoother than oil, yet are they naked swords.

55.a: Cast your burden upon the Lord and he will sustain you,  ♦
55.b: and will not let the righteous fall for ever.

55.a: But those that are bloodthirsty and deceitful, O God,  ♦
55.b: you will bring down to the pit of destruction.

55.a: They shall not live out half their days,  ♦
55.b: but my trust shall be in you, O Lord.

56.a: Have mercy on me, O God, for they trample over me;  ♦
56.b: all day long they assault and oppress me.

56.a: My adversaries trample over me all the day long;  ♦
56.b: many are they that make proud war against me.

56.a: In the day of my fear I put my trust in you,  ♦
56.b: in God whose word I praise.

56.a: In God I trust, and will not fear,  ♦
56.b: for what can flesh do to me?

56.a: All day long they wound me with words;  ♦
56.b: their every thought is to do me evil.

56.a: They stir up trouble; they lie in wait;  ♦
56.b: marking my steps, they seek my life.

56.a: Shall they escape for all their wickedness?  ♦
56.b: In anger, O God, cast the peoples down.

56.a:
You have counted up my groaning;
    put my tears into your bottle;  ♦
56.b: are they not written in your book?

56.a:
Then shall my enemies turn back
    on the day when I call upon you;  ♦
56.b: this I know, for God is on my side.

56.a:
In God whose word I praise,
    in the Lord whose word I praise,  ♦
56.b:
in God I trust and will not fear:
    what can flesh do to me?

56.a: To you, O God, will I fulfil my vows;  ♦
56.b: to you will I present my offerings of thanks,

56.a:
For you will deliver my soul from death
    and my feet from falling,  ♦
56.b: that I may walk before God in the light of the living.

57.a: Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me,  ♦
57.b: for my soul takes refuge in you;

57.a: In the shadow of your wings will I take refuge  ♦
57.b: until the storm of destruction has passed by.

57.a: I will call upon the Most High God,  ♦
57.b: the God who fulfils his purpose for me.

57.a:
He will send from heaven and save me
    and rebuke those that would trample upon me;  ♦
57.b: God will send forth his love and his faithfulness.

57.a: I lie in the midst of lions,  ♦
57.b:
people whose teeth are spears and arrows,
    and their tongue a sharp sword.

57.a: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens,  ♦
57.b: and your glory over all the earth.

57.a:
They have laid a net for my feet;
    my soul is pressed down;  ♦
57.b:
they have dug a pit before me
    and will fall into it themselves.

57.a: My heart is ready, O God, my heart is ready;  ♦
57.b: I will sing and give you praise.

57.a: Awake, my soul; awake, harp and lyre,  ♦
57.b: that I may awaken the dawn.

57.a: I will give you thanks, O Lord, among the peoples;  ♦
57.b: I will sing praise to you among the nations.

57.a: For your loving-kindness is as high as the heavens,  ♦
57.b: and your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.

57.a: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens,  ♦
57.b: and your glory over all the earth.

58.a: Do you indeed speak justly, you mighty?  ♦
58.b: Do you rule the peoples with equity?

58.a: With unjust heart you act throughout the land;  ♦
The wicked are estranged, even from the womb;  ♦
58.b: those who speak falsehood go astray from their birth.

58.a: They are as venomous as a serpent;  ♦
58.b: they are like the deaf adder which stops its ears,

58.a: Which does not heed the voice of the charmers,  ♦
58.b: and is deaf to the skilful weaver of spells.

58.a: Break, O God, their teeth in their mouths;  ♦
58.b: smash the fangs of these lions, O Lord.

58.a: Let them vanish like water that runs away;  ♦
58.b: let them wither like trodden grass.

58.a: Let them be as the slimy track of the snail,  ♦
58.b: like the untimely birth that never sees the sun.

58.a: Before ever their pots feel the heat of the thorns,  ♦
58.b: green or blazing, let them be swept away.

58.a: The righteous will be glad when they see God’s vengeance;  ♦
58.b: they will bathe their feet in the blood of the wicked.

58.a:
So that people will say,
    ‘Truly, there is a harvest for the righteous;  ♦
58.b: truly, there is a God who judges in the earth.’

59.a: Rescue me from my enemies, O my God;  ♦
59.b: set me high above those that rise up against me.

59.a: Save me from the evildoers  ♦
59.b: and from murderous foes deliver me.

59.a: For see how they lie in wait for my soul  ♦
59.b: and the mighty stir up trouble against me.

59.a: Not for any fault or sin of mine, O Lord;  ♦
59.b: for no offence, they run and prepare themselves for war.

59.a: Rouse yourself, come to my aid and see;  ♦
59.b: for you are the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel.

59.a: Awake, and judge all the nations;  ♦
59.b: show no mercy to the evil traitors.

59.a: They return at nightfall and snarl like dogs  ♦
59.b: and prowl about the city.

59.a:
They pour out evil words with their mouths;
    swords are on their lips;  ♦
59.b: ‘For who’, they say, ‘can hear us?’

59.a: But you laugh at them, O Lord;  ♦
59.b: you hold all the nations in derision.

59.a: For you, O my strength, will I watch;  ♦
59.b: you, O God, are my strong tower.

59.a: My God in his steadfast love will come to me;  ♦
59.b: he will let me behold the downfall of my enemies.

59.a: Slay them not, lest my people forget;  ♦
59.b:
send them reeling by your might
    and bring them down, O Lord our shield.

59.a: For the sins of their mouth, for the words of their lips,  ♦
59.b: let them be taken in their pride.

59.a: For the cursing and falsehood they have uttered,  ♦
59.b: consume them in wrath, consume them till they are no more.

59.a: And they shall know that God rules in Jacob,  ♦
59.b: and to the ends of the earth.

59.a: And still they return at nightfall and snarl like dogs  ♦
59.b: and prowl about the city.

59.a: Though they forage for something to devour,  ♦
59.b: and howl if they are not filled,

59.a: Yet will I sing of your strength  ♦
59.b: and every morning praise your steadfast love;

59.a: For you have been my stronghold,  ♦
59.b: my refuge in the day of my trouble.

59.a: To you, O my strength, will I sing;  ♦
59.b:
for you, O God, are my refuge,
    my God of steadfast love.

60.a: O God, you have cast us off and broken us;  ♦
60.b: you have been angry; restore us to yourself again.

60.a: You have shaken the earth and torn it apart;  ♦
60.b: heal its wounds, for it trembles.

60.a: You have made your people drink bitter things;  ♦
60.b: we reel from the deadly wine you have given us.

60.a: You have made those who fear you to flee,  ♦
60.b: to escape from the range of the bow.

60.a: That your beloved may be delivered,  ♦
60.b: save us by your right hand and answer us.

60.a: God has spoken in his holiness:  ♦
60.b:
‘I will triumph and divide Shechem,
    and share out the valley of Succoth.

60.a: ‘Gilead is mine and Manasseh is mine;  ♦
60.b: Ephraim is my helmet and Judah my sceptre.

60.a:
‘Moab shall be my washpot;
    over Edom will I cast my sandal;  ♦
60.b: across Philistia will I shout in triumph.’

60.a: Who will lead me into the strong city?  ♦
60.b: Who will bring me into Edom?

60.a: Have you not cast us off, O God?  ♦
60.b: Will you no longer go forth with our troops?

60.a: Grant us your help against the enemy,  ♦
60.b: for earthly help is in vain.

60.a: Through God will we do great acts,  ♦
60.b: for it is he that shall tread down our enemies.

61.a: From the end of the earth I call to you with fainting heart;  ♦
61.b: O set me on the rock that is higher than I.
a strong tower against the enemy.

61.a: Let me dwell in your tent for ever  ♦
61.b: and take refuge under the cover of your wings.

61.a: For you, O God, will hear my vows;  ♦
61.b: you will grant the request of those who fear your name.

61.a: You will add length of days to the life of the king,  ♦
61.b: that his years may endure throughout all generations.

61.a: May he sit enthroned before God for ever;  ♦
61.b: may steadfast love and truth watch over him.

61.a: So will I always sing praise to your name,  ♦
61.b: and day by day fulfil my vows.

62.a: On God alone my soul in stillness waits;  ♦
He alone is my rock and my salvation,  ♦
62.b: my stronghold, so that I shall never be shaken.

62.a: How long will all of you assail me to destroy me,  ♦
62.b: as you would a tottering wall or a leaning fence?

62.a:
They plot only to thrust me down from my place of honour;
    lies are their chief delight;  ♦
62.b: they bless with their mouth, but in their heart they curse.

62.a: Wait on God alone in stillness, O my soul;  ♦
62.b: for in him is my hope.

62.a: He alone is my rock and my salvation,  ♦
62.b: my stronghold, so that I shall not be shaken.

62.a: In God is my strength and my glory;  ♦
62.b: God is my strong rock; in him is my refuge.

62.a: Put your trust in him always, my people;  ♦
62.b: pour out your hearts before him, for God is our refuge.

62.a:
The peoples are but a breath,
    the whole human race a deceit;  ♦
62.b: on the scales they are altogether lighter than air.

62.a: Put no trust in oppression; in robbery take no empty pride;  ♦
62.b: though wealth increase, set not your heart upon it.

62.a: God spoke once, and twice have I heard the same,  ♦
Steadfast love belongs to you, O Lord,  ♦
62.b: for you repay everyone according to their deeds.

63.a: O God, you are my God; eagerly I seek you;  ♦
63.b: my soul is athirst for you.

63.a: My flesh also faints for you,  ♦
63.b: as in a dry and thirsty land where there is no water.

63.a: So would I gaze upon you in your holy place,  ♦
63.b: that I might behold your power and your glory.

63.a: Your loving-kindness is better than life itself  ♦
63.b: and so my lips shall praise you.

63.a: I will bless you as long as I live  ♦
63.b: and lift up my hands in your name.

63.a: My soul shall be satisfied, as with marrow and fatness,  ♦
63.b: and my mouth shall praise you with joyful lips,

63.a: When I remember you upon my bed  ♦
63.b: and meditate on you in the watches of the night.

63.a: For you have been my helper  ♦
63.b: and under the shadow of your wings will I rejoice.
your right hand shall hold me fast.

63.a: But those who seek my soul to destroy it  ♦
63.b: shall go down to the depths of the earth;

63.a: Let them fall by the edge of the sword  ♦
63.b: and become a portion for jackals.

63.a:
But the king shall rejoice in God;
    all those who swear by him shall be glad,  ♦
63.b: for the mouth of those who speak lies shall be stopped.

64.a: Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint;  ♦
64.b: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

64.a: Hide me from the conspiracy of the wicked,  ♦
They sharpen their tongue like a sword  ♦
64.b: and aim their bitter words like arrows,

64.a: That they may shoot at the blameless from hiding places;  ♦
64.b: suddenly they shoot, and are not seen.

64.a: They hold fast to their evil course;  ♦
64.b: they talk of laying snares, saying, ‘Who will see us?’

64.a: They search out wickedness and lay a cunning trap,  ♦
64.b: for deep are the inward thoughts of the heart.

64.a: But God will shoot at them with his swift arrow,  ♦
64.b: and suddenly they shall be wounded.

64.a: Their own tongues shall make them fall,  ♦
64.b: and all who see them shall wag their heads in scorn.

64.a: All peoples shall fear and tell what God has done,  ♦
64.b: and they will ponder all his works.

64.a:
The righteous shall rejoice in the Lord
    and put their trust in him,  ♦
64.b: and all that are true of heart shall exult.

65.a: Praise is due to you, O God, in Zion;  ♦
65.b: to you that answer prayer shall vows be paid.

65.a: To you shall all flesh come to confess their sins;  ♦
65.b:
when our misdeeds prevail against us,
    you will purge them away.

65.a:
Happy are they whom you choose
    and draw to your courts to dwell there.  ♦
65.b:
We shall be satisfied with the blessings of your house,
    even of your holy temple.

65.a:
With wonders you will answer us in your righteousness,
    O God of our salvation,  ♦
65.b:
O hope of all the ends of the earth
    and of the farthest seas.

65.a: In your strength you set fast the mountains  ♦
65.b: and are girded about with might.

65.a: You still the raging of the seas,  ♦
65.b:
the roaring of their waves
    and the clamour of the peoples.

65.a:
Those who dwell at the ends of the earth
    tremble at your marvels;  ♦
65.b: the gates of the morning and evening sing your praise.

65.a: You visit the earth and water it;  ♦
The river of God is full of water;  ♦
65.b:
you prepare grain for your people,
    for so you provide for the earth.

65.a: You drench the furrows and smooth out the ridges;  ♦
65.b: you soften the ground with showers and bless its increase.

65.a: You crown the year with your goodness,  ♦
65.b: and your paths overflow with plenty.

65.a: May the pastures of the wilderness flow with goodness  ♦
65.b: and the hills be girded with joy.

65.a: May the meadows be clothed with flocks of sheep  ♦
65.b:
and the valleys stand so thick with corn
    that they shall laugh and sing.

66.a: Be joyful in God, all the earth;  ♦
66.b:
sing the glory of his name;
    sing the glory of his praise.

66.a: Say to God, ‘How awesome are your deeds!  ♦
66.b:
Because of your great strength
    your enemies shall bow before you.
sing to you, sing praise to your name.’

66.a: Come now and behold the works of God,  ♦
66.b: how wonderful he is in his dealings with humankind.

66.a:
He turned the sea into dry land;
    the river they passed through on foot;  ♦

In his might he rules for ever;
    his eyes keep watch over the nations;  ♦
66.b: let no rebel rise up against him.

66.a: Bless our God, O you peoples;  ♦
66.b: make the voice of his praise to be heard,

66.a: Who holds our souls in life  ♦
66.b: and suffers not our feet to slip.

66.a: For you, O God, have proved us;  ♦
66.b: you have tried us as silver is tried.

66.a: You brought us into the snare;  ♦
66.b: you laid heavy burdens upon our backs.

66.a:
You let enemies ride over our heads;
    we went through fire and water;  ♦
66.b: but you brought us out into a place of liberty.

66.a:
I will come into your house with burnt offerings
    and will pay you my vows,  ♦
66.b:
which my lips uttered
    and my mouth promised when I was in trouble.

66.a:
I will offer you fat burnt sacrifices
    with the smoke of rams;  ♦
66.b: I will sacrifice oxen and goats.

66.a: Come and listen, all you who fear God,  ♦
66.b: and I will tell you what he has done for my soul.

66.a: I called out to him with my mouth  ♦
66.b: and his praise was on my tongue.

66.a: If I had nursed evil in my heart,  ♦
66.b: the Lord would not have heard me,

66.a: But in truth God has heard me;  ♦
66.b: he has heeded the voice of my prayer.

66.a: Blessed be God, who has not rejected my prayer,  ♦
66.b: nor withheld his loving mercy from me.

67.a: God be gracious to us and bless us  ♦
67.b: and make his face to shine upon us,

67.a: That your way may be known upon earth,  ♦
67.b: your saving power among all nations.

67.a: Let the peoples praise you, O God;  ♦
67.b: let all the peoples praise you.

67.a: O let the nations rejoice and be glad,  ♦
67.b:
for you will judge the peoples righteously
    and govern the nations upon earth.

67.a: Let the peoples praise you, O God;  ♦
67.b: let all the peoples praise you.

67.a: Then shall the earth bring forth her increase,  ♦
67.b: and God, our own God, will bless us.
and all the ends of the earth shall fear him.

68.a: Let God arise and let his enemies be scattered;  ♦
68.b: let those that hate him flee before him.

68.a: As the smoke vanishes, so may they vanish away;  ♦
68.b:
as wax melts at the fire,
    so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.

68.a: But let the righteous be glad and rejoice before God;  ♦
68.b: let them make merry with gladness.

68.a:
Sing to God, sing praises to his name;
    exalt him who rides on the clouds.  ♦
68.b: The Lord is his name; rejoice before him.

68.a: Father of the fatherless, defender of widows,  ♦
68.b: God in his holy habitation!

68.a:
God gives the solitary a home
    and brings forth prisoners to songs of welcome,  ♦
68.b: but the rebellious inhabit a burning desert.

68.a: O God, when you went forth before your people,  ♦
68.b: when you marched through the wilderness,

68.a:
The earth shook and the heavens dropped down rain,
    at the presence of God, the Lord of Sinai,  ♦
68.b: at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

68.a: You sent down a gracious rain, O God;  ♦
68.b: you refreshed your inheritance when it was weary.

68.a: Your people came to dwell there;  ♦
68.b: in your goodness, O God, you provide for the poor.

68.a:
The Lord gave the word;
    great was the company of women who bore the tidings:  ♦
68.b:
‘Kings and their armies they flee, they flee!’
    and women at home are dividing the spoil.

68.a: Though you stayed among the sheepfolds,  ♦
68.b:
see now a dove’s wings covered with silver
    and its feathers with green gold.

68.a: When the Almighty scattered the kings,  ♦
68.b: it was like snowflakes falling on Zalmon.

68.a: You mighty mountain, great mountain of Bashan!  ♦
68.b: You towering mountain, great mountain of Bashan!

68.a:
Why look with envy, you towering mountains,
    at the mount which God has desired for his dwelling,  ♦
68.b: the place where the Lord will dwell for ever?

68.a:
The chariots of God are twice ten thousand,
    even thousands upon thousands;  ♦
68.b: the Lord is among them, the Lord of Sinai in holy power.

68.a: You have gone up on high and led captivity captive;  ♦
68.b:
you have received tribute,
    even from those who rebelled,
    that you may reign as Lord and God.

68.a: Blessed be the Lord who bears our burdens day by day,  ♦
68.b: for God is our salvation.

68.a: God is for us the God of our salvation;  ♦
68.b: God is the Lord who can deliver from death.

68.a: God will smite the head of his enemies,  ♦
68.b: the hairy scalp of those who walk in wickedness.

68.a: The Lord has said, ‘From the heights of Bashan,  ♦
68.b: from the depths of the sea will I bring them back,

68.a: ‘Till you dip your foot in blood  ♦
68.b: and the tongue of your dogs has a taste of your enemies.’

68.a: We see your solemn processions, O God,  ♦
68.b: your processions into the sanctuary, my God and my King.

68.a: The singers go before, the musicians follow after,  ♦
68.b: in the midst of maidens playing on timbrels.

68.a: In your companies, bless your God;  ♦
68.b: bless the Lord, you that are of the fount of Israel.

68.a:
At the head there is Benjamin, least of the tribes,
    the princes of Judah in joyful company,  ♦
68.b: the princes of Zebulun and Naphtali.

68.a: Send forth your strength, O God;  ♦
68.b: establish, O God, what you have wrought in us.

68.a: For your temple’s sake in Jerusalem  ♦
68.b: kings shall bring their gifts to you.

68.a: Drive back with your word the wild beast of the reeds,  ♦
68.b: the herd of the bull-like, the brutish hordes.

68.a: Trample down those who lust after silver;  ♦
68.b: scatter the peoples that delight in war.

68.a: Vessels of bronze shall be brought from Egypt;  ♦
68.b: Ethiopia will stretch out her hands to God.

68.a: Sing to God, you kingdoms of the earth;  ♦
68.b: make music in praise of the Lord;

68.a: He rides on the ancient heaven of heavens  ♦
68.b: and sends forth his voice, a mighty voice.

68.a: Ascribe power to God, whose splendour is over Israel,  ♦
68.b: whose power is above the clouds.

68.a: How terrible is God in his holy sanctuary,  ♦
68.b:
the God of Israel, who gives power and strength to his people!
    Blessed be God.

69.a: Save me, O God,  ♦
69.b: for the waters have come up, even to my neck.

69.a: I sink in deep mire where there is no foothold;  ♦
69.b: I have come into deep waters and the flood sweeps over me.

69.a: I have grown weary with crying; my throat is raw;  ♦
69.b: my eyes have failed from looking so long for my God.

69.a: Those who hate me without any cause  ♦
69.b: are more than the hairs of my head;

69.a: Those who would destroy me are mighty;  ♦
69.b:
my enemies accuse me falsely:
    must I now give back what I never stole?

69.a: O God, you know my foolishness,  ♦
69.b: and my faults are not hidden from you.

69.a:
Let not those who hope in you
    be put to shame through me, Lord God of hosts;  ♦
69.b:
let not those who seek you be disgraced because of me,
    O God of Israel.

69.a: For your sake have I suffered reproach;  ♦
69.b: shame has covered my face.

69.a: I have become a stranger to my kindred,  ♦
69.b: an alien to my mother’s children.

69.a: Zeal for your house has eaten me up;  ♦
69.b: the scorn of those who scorn you has fallen upon me.

69.a: I humbled myself with fasting,  ♦
69.b: but that was turned to my reproach.

69.a: I put on sackcloth also  ♦
69.b: and became a byword among them.

69.a: Those who sit at the gate murmur against me,  ♦
69.b: and the drunkards make songs about me.

69.a: But as for me, I make my prayer to you, O Lord;  ♦
69.b: at an acceptable time, O God.

69.a: Answer me, O God, in the abundance of your mercy  ♦
69.b: and with your sure salvation.

69.a: Draw me out of the mire, that I sink not;  ♦
69.b:
let me be rescued from those who hate me
    and out of the deep waters.

69.a:
Let not the water flood drown me,
    neither the deep swallow me up;  ♦
69.b: let not the Pit shut its mouth upon me.

69.a: Answer me, Lord, for your loving-kindness is good;  ♦
69.b: turn to me in the multitude of your mercies.

69.a: Hide not your face from your servant;  ♦
69.b: be swift to answer me, for I am in trouble.

69.a: Draw near to my soul and redeem me;  ♦
69.b: deliver me because of my enemies.

69.a: You know my reproach, my shame and my dishonour;  ♦
69.b: my adversaries are all in your sight.

69.a: Reproach has broken my heart; I am full of heaviness.  ♦
69.b:
I looked for some to have pity, but there was no one,
    neither found I any to comfort me.

69.a: They gave me gall to eat,  ♦
69.b: and when I was thirsty, they gave me vinegar to drink.

69.a: Let the table before them be a trap  ♦
69.b: and their sacred feasts a snare.

69.a: Let their eyes be darkened, that they cannot see,  ♦
69.b: and give them continual trembling in their loins.

69.a: Pour out your indignation upon them,  ♦
69.b: and let the heat of your anger overtake them.

69.a: Let their camp be desolate,  ♦
69.b: and let there be no one to dwell in their tents.

69.a: For they persecute the one whom you have stricken,  ♦
69.b: and increase the sorrows of him whom you have pierced.

69.a: Lay to their charge guilt upon guilt,  ♦
69.b: and let them not receive your vindication.

69.a: Let them be wiped out of the book of the living  ♦
69.b: and not be written among the righteous.

69.a: As for me, I am poor and in misery;  ♦
69.b: your saving help, O God, will lift me up.

69.a: I will praise the name of God with a song;  ♦
69.b: I will proclaim his greatness with thanksgiving.

69.a: This will please the Lord more than an offering of oxen,  ♦
69.b: more than bulls with horns and hooves.

69.a: The humble shall see and be glad;  ♦
69.b: you who seek God, your heart shall live.

69.a: For the Lord listens to the needy,  ♦
69.b: and his own who are imprisoned he does not despise.

69.a: Let the heavens and the earth praise him,  ♦
69.b: the seas and all that moves in them;

69.a: For God will save Zion and rebuild the cities of Judah;  ♦
69.b: they shall live there and have it in possession.

69.a: The children of his servants shall inherit it,  ♦
69.b: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.

70.a: O God, make speed to save me;  ♦
70.b: O Lord, make haste to help me.

70.a:
Let those who seek my life
    be put to shame and confusion;  ♦
70.b:
let them be turned back and disgraced
    who wish me evil.

70.a: Let those who mock and deride me  ♦
70.b: turn back because of their shame.

70.a: But let all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you;  ♦
70.b: let those who love your salvation say always, ‘Great is the Lord!’

70.a: As for me, I am poor and needy;  ♦
70.b: come to me quickly, O God.

70.a: You are my help and my deliverer;  ♦

71.a: In you, O Lord, do I seek refuge;  ♦
71.b: let me never be put to shame.

71.a: In your righteousness, deliver me and set me free;  ♦
71.b: incline your ear to me and save me.

71.a: Be for me a stronghold to which I may ever resort;  ♦
71.b: send out to save me, for you are my rock and my fortress.

71.a: Deliver me, my God, from the hand of the wicked,  ♦
71.b: from the grasp of the evildoer and the oppressor.

71.a: For you are my hope, O Lord God,  ♦
71.b: my confidence, even from my youth.

71.a:
Upon you have I leaned from my birth,
    when you drew me from my mother’s womb;  ♦
71.b: my praise shall be always of you.

71.a: I have become a portent to many,  ♦
71.b: but you are my refuge and my strength.

71.a: Let my mouth be full of your praise  ♦
71.b: and your glory all the day long.

71.a: Do not cast me away in the time of old age;  ♦
71.b: forsake me not when my strength fails.

71.a: For my enemies are talking against me,  ♦
71.b: and those who lie in wait for my life take counsel together.

71.a:
They say, ‘God has forsaken him;
    pursue him and take him,  ♦
71.b: because there is none to deliver him.’

71.a: O God, be not far from me;  ♦
71.b: come quickly to help me, O my God.

71.a:
Let those who are against me
    be put to shame and disgrace;  ♦
71.b:
let those who seek to do me evil
    be covered with scorn and reproach.

71.a: But as for me I will hope continually  ♦
71.b: and will praise you more and more.

71.a:
My mouth shall tell of your righteousness
    and salvation all the day long,  ♦
71.b: for I know no end of the telling.

71.a: I will begin with the mighty works of the Lord God;  ♦
71.b: I will recall your righteousness, yours alone.

71.a: O God, you have taught me since I was young,  ♦
71.b: and to this day I tell of your wonderful works.

71.a:
Forsake me not, O God,
    when I am old and grey-headed,  ♦
71.b:
till I make known your deeds to the next generation
    and your power to all that are to come.

71.a: Your righteousness, O God, reaches to the heavens;  ♦
71.b: in the great things you have done, who is like you, O God?

71.a: What troubles and adversities you have shown me,  ♦
71.b:
and yet you will turn and refresh me
    and bring me from the deep of the earth again.

71.a: Increase my honour;  ♦
71.b: turn again and comfort me.

71.a:
Therefore will I praise you upon the harp
    for your faithfulness, O my God;  ♦
71.b: I will sing to you with the lyre, O Holy One of Israel.

71.a: My lips will sing out as I play to you,  ♦
71.b: and so will my soul, which you have redeemed.

71.a: My tongue also will tell of your righteousness all the day long,  ♦
71.b:
for they shall be shamed and disgraced
    who sought to do me evil.

72.a: Give the king your judgements, O God,  ♦
72.b: and your righteousness to the son of a king.

72.a: Then shall he judge your people righteously  ♦
May the mountains bring forth peace,  ♦
72.b: and the little hills righteousness for the people.

72.a: May he defend the poor among the people,  ♦
72.b: deliver the children of the needy and crush the oppressor.

72.a: May he live as long as the sun and moon endure,  ♦
May he come down like rain upon the mown grass,  ♦
72.b: like the showers that water the earth.

72.a: In his time shall righteousness flourish,  ♦
72.b:
and abundance of peace
    till the moon shall be no more.

72.a: May his dominion extend from sea to sea  ♦
72.b: and from the River to the ends of the earth.

72.a: May his foes kneel before him  ♦
72.b: and his enemies lick the dust.

72.a: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall pay tribute;  ♦
72.b: the kings of Sheba and Seba shall bring gifts.

72.a: All kings shall fall down before him;  ♦
72.b: all nations shall do him service.

72.a: For he shall deliver the poor that cry out,  ♦
72.b: the needy and those who have no helper.

72.a: He shall have pity on the weak and poor;  ♦
72.b: he shall preserve the lives of the needy.

72.a: He shall redeem their lives from oppression and violence,  ♦
72.b: and dear shall their blood be in his sight.

72.a:
Long may he live;
    unto him may be given gold from Sheba;  ♦
72.b:
may prayer be made for him continually
    and may they bless him all the day long.

72.a:
May there be abundance of grain on the earth,
    standing thick upon the hilltops;  ♦
72.b:
may its fruit flourish like Lebanon
    and its grain grow like the grass of the field.

72.a:
May his name remain for ever
    and be established as long as the sun endures;  ♦
72.b:
may all nations be blest in him
    and call him blessed.

72.a: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,  ♦
And blessed be his glorious name for ever.  ♦
72.b:
May all the earth be filled with his glory.
    Amen. Amen.

73.a: Truly, God is loving to Israel,  ♦
73.b: to those who are pure in heart.

73.a: Nevertheless, my feet were almost gone;  ♦
73.b: my steps had well-nigh slipped.

73.a: For I was envious of the proud;  ♦
73.b: I saw the wicked in such prosperity;

73.a: For they suffer no pains  ♦
73.b: and their bodies are sleek and sound;

73.a: They come to no misfortune like other folk;  ♦
73.b: nor are they plagued as others are;

73.a: Therefore pride is their necklace  ♦
73.b: and violence wraps them like a cloak.

73.a: Their iniquity comes from within;  ♦
73.b: the conceits of their hearts overflow.

73.a: They scoff, and speak only of evil;  ♦
73.b: they talk of oppression from on high.

73.a: They set their mouth against the heavens,  ♦
73.b: and their tongue ranges round the earth;

73.a: And so the people turn to them  ♦
73.b: and find in them no fault.

73.a: They say, ‘How should God know?  ♦
73.b: Is there knowledge in the Most High?’

73.a: Behold, these are the wicked;  ♦
73.b: ever at ease, they increase their wealth.

73.a: Is it in vain that I cleansed my heart  ♦
73.b: and washed my hands in innocence?

73.a: All day long have I been stricken  ♦
73.b: and chastened every morning.

73.a: If I had said, ‘I will speak as they do,’  ♦
73.b: I should have betrayed the generation of your children.

73.a: Then thought I to understand this,  ♦
73.b: but it was too hard for me,

73.a: Until I entered the sanctuary of God  ♦
73.b: and understood the end of the wicked:

73.a: How you set them in slippery places;  ♦
73.b: you cast them down to destruction.

73.a: How suddenly do they come to destruction,  ♦
73.b: perish and come to a fearful end!

73.a: As with a dream when one awakes,  ♦
73.b: so, Lord, when you arise you will despise their image.

73.a: When my heart became embittered  ♦
73.b: and I was pierced to the quick,

73.a: I was but foolish and ignorant;  ♦
73.b: I was like a brute beast in your presence.

73.a: Yet I am always with you;  ♦
73.b: you hold me by my right hand.

73.a: You will guide me with your counsel  ♦
73.b: and afterwards receive me with glory.

73.a: Whom have I in heaven but you?  ♦
73.b:
And there is nothing upon earth that I desire
    in comparison with you.

73.a: Though my flesh and my heart fail me,  ♦
73.b: God is the strength of my heart and my portion for ever.

73.a: Truly, those who forsake you will perish;  ♦
73.b: you will put to silence the faithless who betray you.

73.a: But it is good for me to draw near to God;  ♦
73.b:
in the Lord God have I made my refuge,
    that I may tell of all your works.

74.a: O God, why have you utterly disowned us?  ♦
74.b:
Why does your anger burn
    against the sheep of your pasture?

74.a: Remember your congregation that you purchased of old,  ♦
74.b:
the tribe you redeemed for your own possession,
    and Mount Zion where you dwelt.

74.a: Hasten your steps towards the endless ruins,  ♦
74.b: where the enemy has laid waste all your sanctuary.

74.a: Your adversaries roared in the place of your worship;  ♦
74.b: they set up their banners as tokens of victory.

74.a: Like men brandishing axes on high in a thicket of trees,  ♦
74.b: all her carved work they smashed down with hatchet and hammer.

74.a: They set fire to your holy place;  ♦
74.b:
they defiled the dwelling place of your name
    and razed it to the ground.

74.a: They said in their heart, ‘Let us make havoc of them altogether,’  ♦
74.b: and they burned down all the sanctuaries of God in the land.

74.a: There are no signs to see, not one prophet left,  ♦
74.b: not one among us who knows how long.

74.a: How long, O God, will the adversary scoff?  ♦
74.b: Shall the enemy blaspheme your name for ever?

74.a: Why have you withheld your hand  ♦
74.b: and hidden your right hand in your bosom?

74.a: Yet God is my king from of old,  ♦
74.b: who did deeds of salvation in the midst of the earth.

74.a: It was you that divided the sea by your might  ♦
74.b: and shattered the heads of the dragons on the waters;

74.a: You alone crushed the heads of Leviathan  ♦
74.b: and gave him to the beasts of the desert for food.

74.a: You cleft the rock for fountain and flood;  ♦
74.b: you dried up ever-flowing rivers.

74.a: Yours is the day, yours also the night;  ♦
74.b: you established the moon and the sun.

74.a: You set all the bounds of the earth;  ♦
74.b: you fashioned both summer and winter.

74.a: Remember now, Lord, how the enemy scoffed,  ♦
74.b: how a foolish people despised your name.

74.a: Do not give to wild beasts the soul of your turtle dove;  ♦
74.b: forget not the lives of your poor for ever.

74.a:
Look upon your creation,
    for the earth is full of darkness,  ♦
74.b: full of the haunts of violence.

74.a: Let not the oppressed turn away ashamed,  ♦
74.b: but let the poor and needy praise your name.

74.a: Arise, O God, maintain your own cause;  ♦
74.b: remember how fools revile you all the day long.

74.a: Forget not the clamour of your adversaries,  ♦
74.b: the tumult of your enemies that ascends continually.

75.a: We give you thanks, O God, we give you thanks,  ♦
75.b: for your name is near, as your wonderful deeds declare.
I, the Lord, will judge with equity.

75.a: ‘Though the earth reels and all that dwell in her,  ♦
75.b: it is I that hold her pillars steady.

75.a: ‘To the boasters I say, “Boast no longer,”  ♦
75.b: and to the wicked, “Do not lift up your horn.

75.a: “‘Do not lift up your horn on high;  ♦
75.b: do not speak with a stiff neck.”’

75.a: For neither from the east nor from the west,  ♦
75.b: nor yet from the wilderness comes exaltation.
he puts down one and raises up another.

75.a: For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup,  ♦
75.b: well mixed and full of foaming wine.

75.a: He pours it out for all the wicked of the earth;  ♦
75.b: they shall drink it, and drain the dregs.

75.a: But I will rejoice for ever  ♦
75.b: and make music to the God of Jacob.

75.a: All the horns of the wicked will I break,  ♦
75.b: but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

76.b: his name is great in Israel.
and his dwelling place in Zion.

76.a: There broke he the flashing arrows of the bow,  ♦
76.b: the shield, the sword and the weapons of war.

76.a: In the light of splendour you appeared,  ♦
The boastful were plundered; they have slept their sleep;  ♦
76.b: none of the warriors can lift their hand.

76.a: At your rebuke, O God of Jacob,  ♦
76.b: both horse and chariot fell stunned.
who can stand before your face when you are angry?

76.a: You caused your judgement to be heard from heaven;  ♦
76.b: the earth trembled and was still,
to save all the meek upon earth.

76.a: You crushed the wrath of the peoples  ♦
Make a vow to the Lord your God and keep it;  ♦
76.b:
let all who are round about him bring gifts
    to him that is worthy to be feared.

76.a: He breaks down the spirit of princes  ♦
76.b: and strikes terror in the kings of the earth.

77.a: I cry aloud to God;  ♦
77.b: I cry aloud to God and he will hear me.

77.a: In the day of my trouble I have sought the Lord;  ♦
77.b:
by night my hand is stretched out and does not tire;
    my soul refuses comfort.

77.a: I think upon God and I groan;  ♦
77.b: I ponder, and my spirit faints.

77.a: You will not let my eyelids close;  ♦
77.b: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.

77.a: I consider the days of old;  ♦
77.b: I remember the years long past;

77.a: I commune with my heart in the night;  ♦
77.b: my spirit searches for understanding.

77.a: Will the Lord cast us off for ever?  ♦
77.b: Will he no more show us his favour?

77.a: Has his loving mercy clean gone for ever?  ♦
77.b: Has his promise come to an end for evermore?

77.a: Has God forgotten to be gracious?  ♦
77.b: Has he shut up his compassion in displeasure?

77.a: And I said, ‘My grief is this:  ♦
77.b: that the right hand of the Most High has lost its strength.’

77.a: I will remember the works of the Lord  ♦
77.b: and call to mind your wonders of old time.

77.a: I will meditate on all your works  ♦
77.b: and ponder your mighty deeds.

77.a: Your way, O God, is holy;  ♦
77.b: who is so great a god as our God?

77.a: You are the God who worked wonders  ♦
77.b: and declared your power among the peoples.

77.a: With a mighty arm you redeemed your people,  ♦
77.b: the children of Jacob and Joseph.

77.a:
The waters saw you, O God;
    the waters saw you and were afraid;  ♦
77.b: the depths also were troubled.

77.a: The clouds poured out water; the skies thundered;  ♦
77.b: your arrows flashed on every side;

77.a:
The voice of your thunder was in the whirlwind;
    your lightnings lit up the ground;  ♦
77.b: the earth trembled and shook.

77.a: Your way was in the sea, and your paths in the great waters,  ♦
77.b: but your footsteps were not known.

77.a: You led your people like sheep  ♦
77.b: by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

78.a: Hear my teaching, O my people;  ♦
78.b: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

78.a: I will open my mouth in a parable;  ♦
78.b: I will pour forth mysteries from of old,

78.a: Such as we have heard and known,  ♦
78.b: which our forebears have told us.

78.a:
We will not hide from their children,
    but will recount to generations to come,  ♦
78.b:
the praises of the Lord and his power
    and the wonderful works he has done.

78.a:
He laid a solemn charge on Jacob
    and made it a law in Israel,  ♦
78.b: which he commanded them to teach their children,

78.a:
That the generations to come might know,
    and the children yet unborn,  ♦
78.b: that they in turn might tell it to their children;

78.a: So that they might put their trust in God  ♦
78.b:
and not forget the deeds of God,
    but keep his commandments,

78.a:
And not be like their forebears,
    a stubborn and rebellious generation,  ♦
78.b:
a generation whose heart was not steadfast,
    and whose spirit was not faithful to God.

78.a: The people of Ephraim, armed with the bow,  ♦
78.b: turned back in the day of battle;

78.a: They did not keep the covenant of God  ♦
78.b: and refused to walk in his law;

78.a: They forgot what he had done  ♦
78.b: and the wonders he had shown them.

78.a: For he did marvellous things in the sight of their forebears,  ♦
78.b: in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.

78.a: He divided the sea and let them pass through;  ♦
78.b: he made the waters stand still in a heap.

78.a: He led them with a cloud by day  ♦
78.b: and all the night through with a blaze of fire.

78.a: He split the hard rocks in the wilderness  ♦
78.b: and gave them drink as from the great deep.

78.a: He brought streams out of the rock  ♦
78.b: and made water gush out like rivers.

78.a: Yet for all this they sinned more against him  ♦
78.b: and defied the Most High in the wilderness.

78.a: They tested God in their hearts  ♦
78.b: and demanded food for their craving.

78.a: They spoke against God and said,  ♦
78.b: ‘Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?

78.a:
‘He struck the rock indeed, so that the waters gushed out
    and the streams overflowed,  ♦
78.b: but can he give bread or provide meat for his people?’

78.a: When the Lord heard this, he was full of wrath;  ♦
78.b:
a fire was kindled against Jacob
    and his anger went out against Israel,

78.a: For they had no faith in God  ♦
78.b: and put no trust in his saving help.

78.a: So he commanded the clouds above  ♦
78.b: and opened the doors of heaven.

78.a: He rained down upon them manna to eat  ♦
78.b: and gave them the grain of heaven.

78.a: So mortals ate the bread of angels;  ♦
78.b: he sent them food in plenty.

78.a: He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens  ♦
78.b: and led out the south wind by his might.

78.a: He rained flesh upon them as thick as dust  ♦
78.b: and winged fowl like the sand of the sea.

78.a: He let it fall in the midst of their camp  ♦
78.b: and round about their tents.

78.a: So they ate and were well filled,  ♦
78.b: for he gave them what they desired.

78.a: But they did not stop their craving;  ♦
78.b: their food was still in their mouths,

78.a: When the anger of God rose against them,  ♦
78.b:
and slew their strongest men
    and felled the flower of Israel.

78.a: But for all this, they sinned yet more  ♦
78.b: and put no faith in his wonderful works.

78.a: So he brought their days to an end like a breath  ♦
78.b: and their years in sudden terror.

78.a: Whenever he slew them, they would seek him;  ♦
78.b: they would repent and earnestly search for God.

78.a: They remembered that God was their rock  ♦
78.b: and the Most High God their redeemer.

78.a: Yet they did but flatter him with their mouth  ♦
78.b: and dissembled with their tongue.

78.a: Their heart was not steadfast towards him,  ♦
78.b: neither were they faithful to his covenant.

78.a:
But he was so merciful that he forgave their misdeeds
    and did not destroy them;  ♦
78.b:
many a time he turned back his wrath
    and did not suffer his whole displeasure to be roused.

78.a: For he remembered that they were but flesh,  ♦
78.b: a wind that passes by and does not return.

78.a: How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness  ♦
78.b: and grieved him in the desert!

78.a: Again and again they tempted God  ♦
78.b: and provoked the Holy One of Israel.

78.a: They did not remember his power  ♦
78.b: in the day when he redeemed them from the enemy;

78.a: How he had wrought his signs in Egypt  ♦
78.b: and his wonders in the field of Zoan.

78.a: He turned their rivers into blood,  ♦
78.b: so that they could not drink of their streams.

78.a: He sent swarms of flies among them, which devoured them,  ♦
78.b: and frogs which brought them ruin.

78.a: He gave their produce to the caterpillar,  ♦
78.b: the fruit of their toil to the locust.

78.a: He destroyed their vines with hailstones  ♦
78.b: and their sycamore trees with the frost.

78.a: He delivered their cattle to hailstones  ♦
78.b: and their flocks to thunderbolts.

78.a: He set loose on them his blazing anger:  ♦
78.b:
fury, displeasure and trouble,
    a troop of destroying angels.

78.a:
He made a way for his anger
    and spared not their souls from death,  ♦
78.b: but gave their life over to the pestilence.

78.a: He smote the firstborn of Egypt,  ♦
78.b: the first fruits of their strength in the tents of Ham.

78.a: But he led out his people like sheep  ♦
78.b: and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

78.a: He led them to safety and they were not afraid,  ♦
78.b: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

78.a: He brought them to his holy place,  ♦
78.b: the mountain which his right hand took in possession.

78.a:
He drove out the nations before them
    and shared out to them their inheritance;  ♦
78.b: he settled the tribes of Israel in their tents.

78.a:
Yet still they tested God Most High
    and rebelled against him,  ♦
78.b: and would not keep his commandments.

78.a: They turned back and fell away like their forebears,  ♦
78.b: starting aside like an unstrung bow.

78.a: They grieved him with their hill altars  ♦
78.b: and provoked him to displeasure with their idols.

78.a: God heard and was greatly angered,  ♦
78.b: and utterly rejected Israel.

78.a: He forsook the tabernacle at Shiloh,  ♦
78.b: the tent of his presence on earth.

78.a: He gave the ark of his strength into captivity,  ♦
78.b: his splendour into the adversary’s hand.

78.a: He delivered his people to the sword  ♦
78.b: and raged against his inheritance.

78.a: The fire consumed their young men;  ♦
78.b: there was no one to lament their maidens.

78.a: Their priests fell by the sword,  ♦
78.b: and their widows made no lamentation.

78.a: Then the Lord woke as out of sleep,  ♦
78.b: like a warrior who had been overcome with wine.

78.a: He struck his enemies from behind  ♦
78.b: and put them to perpetual shame.

78.a: He rejected the tent of Joseph  ♦
78.b: and chose not the tribe of Ephraim,

78.a: But he chose the tribe of Judah  ♦
78.b: and the hill of Zion, which he loved.

78.a: And there he built his sanctuary like the heights of heaven,  ♦
78.b: like the earth which he founded for ever.

78.a: He chose David also, his servant,  ♦
78.b: and took him away from the sheepfolds.

78.a: From following the ewes with their lambs he took him,  ♦
78.b:
that he might shepherd Jacob his people
    and Israel his inheritance.

78.a: So he shepherded them with a devoted heart  ♦
78.b: and with skilful hands he guided them.

79.a: O God, the heathen have come into your heritage;  ♦
79.b:
your holy temple have they defiled
    and made Jerusalem a heap of stones.

79.a:
The dead bodies of your servants they have given
    to be food for the birds of the air,  ♦
79.b: and the flesh of your faithful to the beasts of the field.

79.a:
Their blood have they shed like water
    on every side of Jerusalem,  ♦
79.b: and there was no one to bury them.

79.a: We have become the taunt of our neighbours,  ♦
79.b: the scorn and derision of those that are round about us.

79.a: Lord, how long will you be angry, for ever?  ♦
79.b: How long will your jealous fury blaze like fire?

79.a: Pour out your wrath upon the nations that have not known you,  ♦
79.b: and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon your name.
and laid waste his dwelling place.

79.a: Remember not against us our former sins;  ♦
79.b:
let your compassion make haste to meet us,
    for we are brought very low.

79.a: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of your name;  ♦
79.b: deliver us, and wipe away our sins for your name’s sake.

79.a: Let vengeance for your servants’ blood that is shed  ♦
79.b: be known among the nations in our sight.

79.a: Let the sorrowful sighing of the prisoners come before you,  ♦
79.b:
and by your mighty arm
    preserve those who are condemned to die.

79.a: May the taunts with which our neighbours taunted you, Lord,  ♦

But we that are your people and the sheep of your pasture
    will give you thanks for ever,  ♦
79.b: and tell of your praise from generation to generation.

80.a: Hear, O Shepherd of Israel,  ♦
80.b: you that led Joseph like a flock;

80.a: Shine forth, you that are enthroned upon the cherubim,  ♦
80.b: before Ephraim, Benjamin and Manasseh.

80.a: Stir up your mighty strength  ♦

80.a: Turn us again, O God of hosts;  ♦

80.b: look down from heaven and behold;

80.a: Turn us again, O Lord God of hosts;  ♦
80.b: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be saved.

81.a:
‘I am the Lord your God,

81.b: and let them walk after their own counsels.

82.b: defend the right of the humble and needy;
deliver them from the hand of the wicked.

82.a:
‘They have no knowledge or wisdom;
    they walk on still in darkness:  ♦

and has lent a strong arm to the children of Lot.

and let your glory be over their children.
