94.b: give the arrogant their just deserts.

94.a: Lord, how long shall the wicked,  ♦
94.b: how long shall the wicked triumph?

94.a: How long shall the evildoers boast  ♦
94.b: and pour out such impudent words?

94.a: They crush your people, O Lord,  ♦
94.b: and afflict your heritage.

94.a: They murder the widow and the stranger;  ♦
94.b: the orphans they put to death.

94.a: And yet they say, ‘The Lord will not see,  ♦
94.b: neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.’

94.a: Consider, most stupid of people;  ♦
94.b: you fools, when will you understand?

94.a: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear?  ♦
94.b: He that formed the eye, shall he not see?

94.a: He who corrects the nations, shall he not punish?  ♦
94.b: He who teaches the peoples, does he lack knowledge?

94.a: The Lord knows every human thought,  ♦
94.b: that they are but a breath.

94.a: Blessed are those whom you chasten, O Lord,  ♦
94.b: whom you instruct from your law;

94.a: That you may give them rest in days of adversity,  ♦
94.b: until a pit is dug for the wicked.

94.a: For the Lord will not fail his people,  ♦
94.b: neither will he forsake his inheritance.

94.a: For justice shall return to the righteous,  ♦
94.b: and all that are true of heart shall follow it.

94.a: Who will rise up for me against the wicked?  ♦
94.b: Who will take my part against the evildoers?

94.a: If the Lord had not helped me,  ♦
94.b: my soul would soon have been put to silence.

94.a: And when I said, ‘My foot has slipped’,  ♦
94.b: your loving mercy, O Lord, upheld me.

94.a: In the multitude of cares that troubled my heart,  ♦
94.b: your comforts have refreshed my soul.

94.a: Will you have anything to do with the throne of wickedness,  ♦
94.b: which fashions evil through its law?

94.a: They gather together against the life of the righteous  ♦
94.b: and condemn the innocent to death.

94.a: But the Lord has become my stronghold  ♦
94.b: and my God the rock of my trust.

94.a:
He will turn against them their own wickedness
    and silence them through their own malice;  ♦
94.b: the Lord our God will put them to silence.

95.a: O come, let us sing to the Lord;  ♦
95.b: let us heartily rejoice in the rock of our salvation.

95.a: Let us come into his presence with thanksgiving  ♦
95.b: and be glad in him with psalms.

95.a: For the Lord is a great God  ♦
95.b: and a great king above all gods.

95.a: In his hand are the depths of the earth  ♦
95.b: and the heights of the mountains are his also.

95.a: The sea is his, for he made it,  ♦
95.b: and his hands have moulded the dry land.

95.a: Come, let us worship and bow down  ♦
95.b: and kneel before the Lord our Maker.
we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand.

95.a: O that today you would listen to his voice:  ♦
95.b:
‘Harden not your hearts as at Meribah,
    on that day at Massah in the wilderness,

95.a: ‘When your forebears tested me, and put me to the proof,  ♦
95.b: though they had seen my works.

95.a: ‘Forty years long I detested that generation and said,  ♦
95.b:
“This people are wayward in their hearts;
    they do not know my ways.”
“They shall not enter into my rest.”’

96.a: Sing to the Lord a new song;  ♦
96.b: sing to the Lord, all the earth.

96.a: Sing to the Lord and bless his name;  ♦
96.b: tell out his salvation from day to day.

96.a: Declare his glory among the nations  ♦
96.b: and his wonders among all peoples.

96.a: For great is the Lord and greatly to be praised;  ♦
96.b: he is more to be feared than all gods.

96.a: For all the gods of the nations are but idols;  ♦
96.b: it is the Lord who made the heavens.

96.a: Honour and majesty are before him;  ♦
96.b: power and splendour are in his sanctuary.

96.a: Ascribe to the Lord, you families of the peoples;  ♦
96.b: ascribe to the Lord honour and strength.

96.a: Ascribe to the Lord the honour due to his name;  ♦
96.b: bring offerings and come into his courts.

96.a: O worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness;  ♦
96.b: let the whole earth tremble before him.

96.a: Tell it out among the nations that the Lord is king.  ♦
96.b:
He has made the world so firm that it cannot be moved;
    he will judge the peoples with equity.

96.a: Let the heavens rejoice and let the earth be glad;  ♦
96.b: let the sea thunder and all that is in it;

96.a: Let the fields be joyful and all that is in them;  ♦
96.b: let all the trees of the wood shout for joy before the Lord.

96.a: For he comes, he comes to judge the earth;  ♦
96.b:
with righteousness he will judge the world
    and the peoples with his truth.

97.a: The Lord is king: let the earth rejoice;  ♦
97.b: let the multitude of the isles be glad.

97.a: Clouds and darkness are round about him;  ♦
97.b: righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.
and burns up his enemies on every side.

97.a: His lightnings lit up the world;  ♦
97.b: the earth saw it and trembled.

97.a: The mountains melted like wax at the presence of the Lord,  ♦
97.b: at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
and all the peoples have seen his glory.

97.a:
Confounded be all who worship carved images
    and delight in mere idols.  ♦
97.b: Bow down before him, all you gods.

97.a: Zion heard and was glad, and the daughters of Judah rejoiced,  ♦
97.b: because of your judgements, O Lord.

97.a: For you, Lord, are most high over all the earth;  ♦
97.b: you are exalted far above all gods.

97.a: The Lord loves those who hate evil;  ♦
97.b:
he preserves the lives of his faithful
    and delivers them from the hand of the wicked.

97.a: Light has sprung up for the righteous  ♦
97.b: and joy for the true of heart.

97.a: Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous,  ♦
97.b: and give thanks to his holy name.

98.a: Sing to the Lord a new song,  ♦
98.b: for he has done marvellous things.

98.a: His own right hand and his holy arm  ♦
98.b: have won for him the victory.

98.a: The Lord has made known his salvation;  ♦
98.b: his deliverance has he openly shown in the sight of the nations.

98.a:
He has remembered his mercy and faithfulness
    towards the house of Israel,  ♦
98.b: and all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

98.a: Sound praises to the Lord, all the earth;  ♦
98.b: break into singing and make music.

98.a: Make music to the Lord with the lyre,  ♦
98.b: with the lyre and the voice of melody.

98.a: With trumpets and the sound of the horn  ♦
98.b: sound praises before the Lord, the King.

98.a: Let the sea thunder and all that fills it,  ♦
98.b: the world and all that dwell upon it.

98.a: Let the rivers clap their hands  ♦
98.b:
and let the hills ring out together before the Lord,
    for he comes to judge the earth.

98.a: In righteousness shall he judge the world  ♦

99.a: The Lord is king: let the peoples tremble;  ♦
99.b: he is enthroned above the cherubim: let the earth shake.

99.a: The Lord is great in Zion  ♦
Let them praise your name, which is great and awesome;  ♦
99.b: the Lord our God is holy.

99.a:
Mighty king, who loves justice,
    you have established equity;  ♦
99.b: you have executed justice and righteousness in Jacob.
bow down before his footstool, for he is holy.

99.a:
Moses and Aaron among his priests
    and Samuel among those who call upon his name;  ♦
99.b: they called upon the Lord and he answered them.

99.a: He spoke to them out of the pillar of cloud;  ♦
99.b: they kept his testimonies and the law that he gave them.

99.a: You answered them, O Lord our God;  ♦
99.b:
you were a God who forgave them
    and pardoned them for their offences.

99.a:
Exalt the Lord our God
    and worship him upon his holy hill,  ♦
99.b: for the Lord our God is holy.

100.a: O be joyful in the Lord, all the earth;  ♦
100.b:
serve the Lord with gladness
    and come before his presence with a song.

100.a: Know that the Lord is God;  ♦
100.b:
it is he that has made us and we are his;
    we are his people and the sheep of his pasture.

100.a:
Enter his gates with thanksgiving
    and his courts with praise;  ♦
100.b: give thanks to him and bless his name.

100.a: For the Lord is gracious; his steadfast love is everlasting,  ♦
100.b: and his faithfulness endures from generation to generation.

101.a: I will sing of faithfulness and justice;  ♦
101.b: to you, O Lord, will I sing.

101.a: Let me be wise in the way that is perfect:  ♦
101.b: when will you come to me?

101.a: I will walk with purity of heart  ♦
101.b: within the walls of my house.

101.a: I will not set before my eyes  ♦
I abhor the deeds of unfaithfulness;  ♦
101.b: they shall not cling to me.

101.a: A crooked heart shall depart from me;  ♦
101.b: I will not know a wicked person.

101.a: One who slanders a neighbour in secret  ♦
101.b: I will quickly put to silence.

101.a: Haughty eyes and an arrogant heart  ♦
My eyes are upon the faithful in the land,  ♦
101.b: that they may dwell with me.

101.a: One who walks in the way that is pure  ♦
There shall not dwell in my house  ♦

101.b: shall not continue in my sight.

101.a: Morning by morning will I put to silence  ♦
101.b: all the wicked in the land,

101.a: To cut off from the city of the Lord  ♦

102.a: O Lord, hear my prayer  ♦
102.b: and let my crying come before you.

102.a: Hide not your face from me  ♦
102.b: in the day of my distress.

102.a: Incline your ear to me;  ♦
102.b: when I call, make haste to answer me,

102.a: For my days are consumed in smoke  ♦
102.b: and my bones burn away as in a furnace.

102.a: My heart is smitten down and withered like grass,  ♦
102.b: so that I forget to eat my bread.

102.a: From the sound of my groaning  ♦
102.b: my bones cleave fast to my skin.

102.a: I am become like a vulture in the wilderness,  ♦
102.b: like an owl that haunts the ruins.

102.a: I keep watch and am become like a sparrow  ♦
102.b: solitary upon the housetop.

102.a: My enemies revile me all the day long,  ♦
102.b: and those who rage at me have sworn together against me.

102.a: I have eaten ashes for bread  ♦
102.b: and mingled my drink with weeping,

102.a: Because of your indignation and wrath,  ♦
102.b: for you have taken me up and cast me down.

102.a: My days fade away like a shadow,  ♦
102.b: and I am withered like grass.

102.a: But you, O Lord, shall endure for ever  ♦
102.b: and your name through all generations.

102.a: You will arise and have pity on Zion;  ♦
102.b:
it is time to have mercy upon her;
    surely the time has come.

102.a: For your servants love her very stones  ♦
102.b: and feel compassion for her dust.

102.a: Then shall the nations fear your name, O Lord,  ♦
102.b: and all the kings of the earth your glory,

102.a: When the Lord has built up Zion  ♦
102.b: and shown himself in glory;

102.a: When he has turned to the prayer of the destitute  ♦
102.b: and has not despised their plea.

102.a: This shall be written for those that come after,  ♦
102.b: and a people yet unborn shall praise the Lord.

102.a: For he has looked down from his holy height;  ♦
102.b: from the heavens he beheld the earth,

102.a: That he might hear the sighings of the prisoner  ♦
102.b: and set free those condemned to die;

102.a: That the name of the Lord may be proclaimed in Zion  ♦
102.b: and his praises in Jerusalem,

102.a: When peoples are gathered together  ♦
102.b: and kingdoms also, to serve the Lord.

102.a: He has brought down my strength in my journey  ♦
102.b: and has shortened my days.

102.a: I pray, ‘O my God, do not take me in the midst of my days;  ♦
102.b: your years endure throughout all generations.

102.a: ‘In the beginning you laid the foundations of the earth,  ♦
102.b: and the heavens are the work of your hands;

102.a: ‘They shall perish, but you will endure;  ♦
102.b: they all shall wear out like a garment.

102.a: ‘You change them like clothing, and they shall be changed;  ♦
102.b: but you are the same, and your years will not fail.

102.a: ‘The children of your servants shall continue,  ♦
102.b: and their descendants shall be established in your sight.’

103.a: Bless the Lord, O my soul,  ♦
103.b: and all that is within me bless his holy name.

103.a: Bless the Lord, O my soul,  ♦
103.b: and forget not all his benefits;

103.a: Who forgives all your sins  ♦
103.b: and heals all your infirmities;

103.a: Who redeems your life from the Pit  ♦
103.b: and crowns you with faithful love and compassion;

103.a: Who satisfies you with good things,  ♦
103.b: so that your youth is renewed like an eagle’s.

103.a: The Lord executes righteousness  ♦
103.b: and judgement for all who are oppressed.

103.a: He made his ways known to Moses  ♦
103.b: and his works to the children of Israel.

103.a: The Lord is full of compassion and mercy,  ♦
103.b: slow to anger and of great kindness.

103.a: He will not always accuse us,  ♦
103.b: neither will he keep his anger for ever.

103.a: He has not dealt with us according to our sins,  ♦
103.b: nor rewarded us according to our wickedness.

103.a: For as the heavens are high above the earth,  ♦
103.b: so great is his mercy upon those who fear him.

103.a: As far as the east is from the west,  ♦
103.b: so far has he set our sins from us.

103.a: As a father has compassion on his children,  ♦
103.b: so is the Lord merciful towards those who fear him.

103.a: For he knows of what we are made;  ♦
103.b: he remembers that we are but dust.

103.a: Our days are but as grass;  ♦
103.b: we flourish as a flower of the field;

103.a: For as soon as the wind goes over it, it is gone,  ♦
103.b: and its place shall know it no more.

103.a:
But the merciful goodness of the Lord is from of old
    and endures for ever on those who fear him,  ♦
103.b: and his righteousness on children’s children;

103.a: On those who keep his covenant  ♦
103.b: and remember his commandments to do them.

103.a: The Lord has established his throne in heaven,  ♦
103.b: and his kingdom has dominion over all.

103.a: Bless the Lord, you angels of his,  ♦
103.b:
you mighty ones who do his bidding
    and hearken to the voice of his word.

103.a: Bless the Lord, all you his hosts,  ♦
103.b: you ministers of his who do his will.

103.a:
Bless the Lord, all you works of his,
    in all places of his dominion;  ♦
103.b: bless the Lord, O my soul.

104.a: Bless the Lord, O my soul.  ♦
104.b: O Lord my God, how excellent is your greatness!

104.a: You are clothed with majesty and honour,  ♦
104.b: wrapped in light as in a garment.

104.a: You spread out the heavens like a curtain  ♦
104.b: and lay the beams of your dwelling place in the waters above.

104.a: You make the clouds your chariot  ♦
104.b: and ride on the wings of the wind.

104.a: You make the winds your messengers  ♦
104.b: and flames of fire your servants.

104.a: You laid the foundations of the earth,  ♦
104.b: that it never should move at any time.

104.a: You covered it with the deep like a garment;  ♦
104.b: the waters stood high above the hills.

104.a: At your rebuke they fled;  ♦
104.b: at the voice of your thunder they hastened away.

104.a: They rose up to the hills and flowed down to the valleys beneath,  ♦
104.b: to the place which you had appointed for them.

104.a: You have set them their bounds that they should not pass,  ♦
104.b: nor turn again to cover the earth.

104.a: You send the springs into the brooks,  ♦
104.b: which run among the hills.

104.a: They give drink to every beast of the field,  ♦
104.b: and the wild asses quench their thirst.

104.a: Beside them the birds of the air make their nests  ♦
104.b: and sing among the branches.

104.a: You water the hills from your dwelling on high;  ♦
104.b: the earth is filled with the fruit of your works.

104.a: You make grass to grow for the cattle  ♦
104.b: and plants to meet our needs,

104.a: Bringing forth food from the earth  ♦
104.b: and wine to gladden our hearts,

104.a: Oil to give us a cheerful countenance  ♦
104.b: and bread to strengthen our hearts.

104.a: The trees of the Lord are full of sap,  ♦
104.b: the cedars of Lebanon which he planted,

104.a: In which the birds build their nests,  ♦
104.b: while the fir trees are a dwelling for the stork.

104.a: The mountains are a refuge for the wild goats  ♦
104.b: and the stony cliffs for the conies.

104.a: You appointed the moon to mark the seasons,  ♦
104.b: and the sun knows the time for its setting.

104.a: You make darkness that it may be night,  ♦
104.b: in which all the beasts of the forest creep forth.

104.a: The lions roar for their prey  ♦
104.b: and seek their food from God.

104.a: The sun rises and they are gone  ♦
104.b: to lay themselves down in their dens.

104.a: People go forth to their work  ♦
104.b: and to their labour until the evening.

104.a: O Lord, how manifold are your works!  ♦
104.b:
In wisdom you have made them all;
    the earth is full of your creatures.

104.a: There is the sea, spread far and wide,  ♦
104.b: and there move creatures beyond number, both small and great.

104.a: There go the ships, and there is that Leviathan  ♦
104.b: which you have made to play in the deep.

104.a: All of these look to you  ♦
104.b: to give them their food in due season.

104.a: When you give it them, they gather it;  ♦
104.b: you open your hand and they are filled with good.

104.a: When you hide your face they are troubled;  ♦
104.b:
when you take away their breath,
    they die and return again to the dust.

104.a: When you send forth your spirit, they are created,  ♦
104.b: and you renew the face of the earth.

104.a: May the glory of the Lord endure for ever;  ♦
104.b: may the Lord rejoice in his works;

104.a: He looks on the earth and it trembles;  ♦
104.b: he touches the mountains and they smoke.

104.a: I will sing to the Lord as long as I live;  ♦
104.b: I will make music to my God while I have my being.

104.a: So shall my song please him  ♦
104.b: while I rejoice in the Lord.

104.a:
Let sinners be consumed out of the earth
    and the wicked be no more.  ♦
104.b:
Bless the Lord, O my soul.
    Alleluia.

105.a: O give thanks to the Lord and call upon his name;  ♦
105.b: make known his deeds among the peoples.

105.a: Sing to him, sing praises,  ♦
105.b: and tell of all his marvellous works.

105.a: Rejoice in the praise of his holy name;  ♦
105.b: let the hearts of them rejoice who seek the Lord.

105.a: Seek the Lord and his strength;  ♦
105.b: seek his face continually.

105.a: Remember the marvels he has done,  ♦
105.b: his wonders and the judgements of his mouth,

105.a: O seed of Abraham his servant,  ♦
105.b: O children of Jacob his chosen.

105.a: He is the Lord our God;  ♦
105.b: his judgements are in all the earth.

105.a: He has always been mindful of his covenant,  ♦
105.b: the promise that he made for a thousand generations:

105.a: The covenant he made with Abraham,  ♦
105.b: the oath that he swore to Isaac,

105.a: Which he established as a statute for Jacob,  ♦
105.b: an everlasting covenant for Israel,

105.a: Saying, ‘To you will I give the land of Canaan  ♦
105.b: to be the portion of your inheritance.’

105.a: When they were but few in number,  ♦
105.b: of little account, and sojourners in the land,

105.a: Wandering from nation to nation,  ♦
105.b: from one kingdom to another people,

105.a: He suffered no one to do them wrong  ♦
105.b: and rebuked even kings for their sake,

105.a: Saying, ‘Touch not my anointed  ♦
105.b: and do my prophets no harm.’

105.a: Then he called down famine over the land  ♦
105.b: and broke every staff of bread.

105.a: But he had sent a man before them,  ♦
105.b: Joseph, who was sold as a slave.

105.a: They shackled his feet with fetters;  ♦
105.b: his neck was ringed with iron.

105.a: Until all he foretold came to pass,  ♦
105.b: the word of the Lord tested him.

105.a: The king sent and released him;  ♦
105.b: the ruler of peoples set him free.

105.a: He appointed him lord of his household  ♦
105.b: and ruler of all he possessed,

105.a: To instruct his princes as he willed  ♦
105.b: and to teach his counsellors wisdom.

105.a: Then Israel came into Egypt;  ♦
105.b: Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

105.a: And the Lord made his people exceedingly fruitful;  ♦
105.b: he made them too many for their adversaries,

105.a: Whose heart he turned, so that they hated his people  ♦
105.b: and dealt craftily with his servants.

105.a: Then sent he Moses his servant  ♦
105.b: and Aaron whom he had chosen.

105.a: He showed his signs through their word  ♦
105.b: and his wonders in the land of Ham.

105.a: He sent darkness and it grew dark;  ♦
105.b: yet they did not heed his words.

105.a: He turned their waters into blood  ♦
105.b: and slew all their fish.

105.a: Their land swarmed with frogs,  ♦
105.b: even in their kings’ chambers.

105.a: He spoke the word, and there came clouds of flies,  ♦
105.b: swarms of gnats within all their borders.

105.a: He gave them hailstones for rain  ♦
105.b: and flames of lightning in their land.

105.a: He blasted their vines and their fig trees  ♦
105.b: and shattered trees across their country.

105.a: He spoke the word, and the grasshoppers came  ♦
105.b: and young locusts without number;

105.a: They ate every plant in their land  ♦
105.b: and devoured the fruit of their soil.

105.a: He smote all the firstborn in their land,  ♦
105.b: the first fruits of all their strength.

105.a: Then he brought them out with silver and gold;  ♦
105.b: there was not one among their tribes that stumbled.

105.a: Egypt was glad at their departing,  ♦
105.b: for a dread of them had fallen upon them.

105.a: He spread out a cloud for a covering  ♦
105.b: and a fire to light up the night.

105.a: They asked and he brought them quails;  ♦
105.b: he satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

105.a: He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out  ♦
105.b: and ran in the dry places like a river.

105.a: For he remembered his holy word  ♦
105.b: and Abraham, his servant.

105.a: So he brought forth his people with joy,  ♦
105.b: his chosen ones with singing.

105.a: He gave them the lands of the nations  ♦
105.b: and they took possession of the fruit of their toil,

105.a: That they might keep his statutes  ♦
105.b:
and faithfully observe his laws.
    Alleluia.

106.a:
Alleluia.
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is gracious,  ♦
106.b: for his faithfulness endures for ever.

106.a: Who can express the mighty acts of the Lord  ♦
106.b: or show forth all his praise?

106.a: Blessed are those who observe what is right  ♦
106.b: and always do what is just.

106.a: Remember me, O Lord, in the favour you bear for your people;  ♦
106.b: visit me in the day of your salvation;

106.a:
That I may see the prosperity of your chosen
    and rejoice in the gladness of your people,  ♦
106.b: and exult with your inheritance.

106.a: We have sinned like our forebears;  ♦
106.b: we have done wrong and dealt wickedly.

106.a:
In Egypt they did not consider your wonders,
    nor remember the abundance of your faithful love;  ♦
106.b: they rebelled against the Most High at the Red Sea.

106.a: But he saved them for his name’s sake,  ♦
106.b: that he might make his power to be known.

106.a: He rebuked the Red Sea and it was dried up;  ♦
106.b: so he led them through the deep as through the wilderness.

106.a: He saved them from the adversary’s hand  ♦
106.b: and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

106.a: As for those that troubled them, the waters overwhelmed them;  ♦
106.b: there was not one of them left.

106.a: Then they believed his words  ♦
106.b: and sang aloud his praise.

106.a: But soon they forgot his deeds  ♦
106.b: and would not wait for his counsel.

106.a: A craving seized them in the wilderness,  ♦
106.b: and they put God to the test in the desert.

106.a: He gave them their desire,  ♦
106.b: but sent a wasting sickness among them.

106.a: They grew jealous of Moses in the camp  ♦
106.b: and of Aaron, the holy one of the Lord.

106.a: So the earth opened and swallowed up Dathan  ♦
106.b: and covered the company of Abiram.

106.a: A fire was kindled in their company;  ♦
106.b: the flame burnt up the wicked.

106.a: They made a calf at Horeb  ♦
106.b: and worshipped the molten image;

106.a: Thus they exchanged their glory  ♦
106.b: for the image of an ox that feeds on hay.

106.a: They forgot God their saviour,  ♦
106.b: who had done such great things in Egypt,

106.a: Wonderful deeds in the land of Ham  ♦
106.b: and fearful things at the Red Sea.

106.a:
So he would have destroyed them,
    had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach,  ♦
106.b: to turn away his wrath from consuming them.

106.a: Then they scorned the Promised Land  ♦
106.b: and would not believe his word,

106.a: But murmured in their tents  ♦
106.b: and would not heed the voice of the Lord.

106.a: So he lifted his hand against them  ♦
106.b: and swore to overthrow them in the wilderness,

106.a: To disperse their descendants among the nations,  ♦
106.b: and to scatter them throughout the lands.

106.a: They joined themselves to the Baal of Peor  ♦
106.b: and ate sacrifices offered to the dead.

106.a: They provoked him to anger with their evil deeds  ♦
106.b: and a plague broke out among them.

106.a: Then Phinehas stood up and interceded  ♦
106.b: and so the plague was stayed.

106.a: This was counted to him for righteousness  ♦
106.b: throughout all generations for ever.

106.a: They angered him also at the waters of Meribah,  ♦
106.b: so that Moses suffered for their sake;

106.a: For they so embittered his spirit  ♦
106.b: that he spoke rash words with his lips.

106.a: They did not destroy the peoples  ♦
106.b: as the Lord had commanded them.

106.a: They mingled with the nations  ♦
106.b: and learned to follow their ways,

106.a: So that they worshipped their idols,  ♦
106.b: which became to them a snare.

106.a: Their own sons and daughters  ♦
106.b: they sacrificed to evil spirits.

106.a: They shed innocent blood,  ♦
106.b: the blood of their sons and daughters,

106.a: Which they offered to the idols of Canaan,  ♦
106.b: and the land was defiled with blood.

106.a: Thus were they polluted by their actions,  ♦
106.b: and in their wanton deeds went whoring after other gods.

106.a:
Therefore was the wrath of the Lord
    kindled against his people,  ♦
106.b: and he abhorred his inheritance.

106.a: He gave them over to the hand of the nations,  ♦
106.b: and those who hated them ruled over them.

106.a: So their enemies oppressed them  ♦
106.b: and put them in subjection under their hand.

106.a:
Many a time did he deliver them,
    but they rebelled through their own devices  ♦
106.b: and were brought down through their wickedness.

106.a: Nevertheless, he saw their adversity,  ♦
106.b: when he heard their lamentation.

106.a: He remembered his covenant with them  ♦
106.b: and relented according to the greatness of his faithful love.

106.a: He made them also to be pitied  ♦
106.b: by all who had taken them captive.

106.a:
Save us, O Lord our God,
    and gather us from among the nations,  ♦
106.b:
that we may give thanks to your holy name
    and glory in your praise.

106.a:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
    from everlasting and to everlasting;  ♦
106.b:
and let all the people say, Amen.
    Alleluia.

107.a: O give thanks to the Lord, for he is gracious,  ♦
107.b: for his steadfast love endures for ever.

107.a: Let the redeemed of the Lord say this,  ♦
107.b: those he redeemed from the hand of the enemy,

107.a:
And gathered out of the lands
    from the east and from the west,  ♦
107.b: from the north and from the south.

107.a: Some went astray in desert wastes  ♦
107.b: and found no path to a city to dwell in.

107.a: Hungry and thirsty,  ♦
107.b: their soul was fainting within them.

107.a: So they cried to the Lord in their trouble  ♦
107.b: and he delivered them from their distress.

107.a: He set their feet on the right way  ♦
107.b: till they came to a city to dwell in.

107.a: Let them give thanks to the Lord for his goodness  ♦
107.b: and the wonders he does for his children.

107.a: For he satisfies the longing soul  ♦
107.b: and fills the hungry soul with good.

107.a: Some sat in darkness and in the shadow of death,  ♦
107.b: bound fast in misery and iron,

107.a: For they had rebelled against the words of God  ♦
107.b: and despised the counsel of the Most High.

107.a: So he bowed down their heart with heaviness;  ♦
107.b: they stumbled and there was none to help them.

107.a: Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble,  ♦
107.b: and he delivered them from their distress.

107.a: He brought them out of darkness and out of the shadow of death,  ♦
107.b: and broke their bonds asunder.

107.a: Let them give thanks to the Lord for his goodness  ♦
107.b: and the wonders he does for his children.

107.a: For he has broken the doors of bronze  ♦
107.b: and breaks the bars of iron in pieces.

107.a: Some were foolish and took a rebellious way,  ♦
107.b: and were plagued because of their wrongdoing.

107.a: Their soul abhorred all manner of food  ♦
107.b: and drew near to the gates of death.

107.a: Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble,  ♦
107.b: and he delivered them from their distress.

107.a: He sent forth his word and healed them,  ♦
107.b: and saved them from destruction.

107.a: Let them give thanks to the Lord for his goodness  ♦
107.b: and the wonders he does for his children.

107.a: Let them offer him sacrifices of thanksgiving  ♦
107.b: and tell of his acts with shouts of joy.

107.a: Those who go down to the sea in ships  ♦
107.b: and ply their trade in great waters,

107.a: These have seen the works of the Lord  ♦
107.b: and his wonders in the deep.

107.a: For at his word the stormy wind arose  ♦
107.b: and lifted up the waves of the sea.

107.a:
They were carried up to the heavens
    and down again to the deep;  ♦
107.b: their soul melted away in their peril.

107.a: They reeled and staggered like a drunkard  ♦
107.b: and were at their wits’ end.

107.a: Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble,  ♦
107.b: and he brought them out of their distress.

107.a: He made the storm be still  ♦
107.b: and the waves of the sea were calmed.

107.a: Then were they glad because they were at rest,  ♦
107.b: and he brought them to the haven they desired.

107.a: Let them give thanks to the Lord for his goodness  ♦
107.b: and the wonders he does for his children.

107.a: Let them exalt him in the congregation of the people  ♦
107.b: and praise him in the council of the elders.

107.a: The Lord turns rivers into wilderness  ♦
107.b: and water springs into thirsty ground;

107.a: A fruitful land he makes a salty waste,  ♦
107.b: because of the wickedness of those who dwell there.

107.a: He makes the wilderness a pool of water  ♦
107.b: and water springs out of a thirsty land.

107.a: There he settles the hungry  ♦
107.b: and they build a city to dwell in.

107.a: They sow fields and plant vineyards  ♦
107.b: and bring in a fruitful harvest.

107.a: He blesses them, so that they multiply greatly;  ♦
107.b: he does not let their herds of cattle decrease.

107.a: He pours contempt on princes  ♦
107.b: and makes them wander in trackless wastes.

107.a: They are diminished and brought low,  ♦
107.b: through stress of misfortune and sorrow,

107.a: But he raises the poor from their misery  ♦
107.b: and multiplies their families like flocks of sheep.

107.a: The upright will see this and rejoice,  ♦
107.b: but all wickedness will shut its mouth.

107.a: Whoever is wise will ponder these things  ♦
107.b: and consider the loving-kindness of the Lord.

108.a: My heart is ready, O God, my heart is ready;  ♦
108.b: I will sing and give you praise.

108.a: Awake, my soul; awake, harp and lyre,  ♦
108.b: that I may awaken the dawn.

108.a: I will give you thanks, O Lord, among the peoples;  ♦
108.b: I will sing praise to you among the nations.

108.a: For your loving-kindness is as high as the heavens  ♦
108.b: and your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.

108.a: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens  ♦
108.b: and your glory over all the earth.

108.a: That your beloved may be delivered,  ♦
108.b: save us by your right hand and answer me.

108.a: God has spoken in his holiness:  ♦
108.b:
‘I will triumph and divide Shechem
    and share out the valley of Succoth.

108.a: ‘Gilead is mine and Manasseh is mine;  ♦
108.b: Ephraim is my helmet and Judah my sceptre.

108.a:
‘Moab shall be my washpot,
    over Edom will I cast my sandal,  ♦
108.b: across Philistia will I shout in triumph.’

108.a: Who will lead me into the strong city?  ♦
108.b: Who will bring me into Edom?

108.a: Have you not cast us off, O God?  ♦
108.b: Will you no longer go forth with our troops?

108.a: O grant us your help against the enemy,  ♦
108.b: for earthly help is in vain.

108.a: Through God will we do great acts,  ♦
108.b: for it is he that shall tread down our enemies.

109.a: Keep silent no longer, O God of my praise,  ♦
109.b:
for the mouth of wickedness and treachery
    is opened against me.

109.a: They have spoken against me with a lying tongue;  ♦
109.b:
they encompassed me with words of hatred
    and fought against me without a cause.

109.a: In return for my love, they set themselves against me,  ♦
109.b: even though I had prayed for them.

109.a: Thus have they repaid me with evil for good,  ♦
109.b: and hatred for my good will.

109.a: They say, ‘Appoint a wicked man over him,  ♦
109.b: and let an accuser stand at his right hand.

109.a: ‘When he is judged, let him be found guilty,  ♦
109.b: and let his prayer be counted as sin.

109.a: ‘Let his days be few  ♦
109.b: and let another take his office.

109.a: ‘Let his children be fatherless  ♦
109.b: and his wife become a widow.

109.a: ‘Let his children wander to beg their bread;  ♦
109.b: let them seek it in desolate places.

109.a: ‘Let the creditor seize all that he has;  ♦
109.b: let strangers plunder the fruit of his toil.

109.a: ‘Let there be no one to keep faith with him,  ♦
109.b: or have compassion on his fatherless children.

109.a: ‘Let his line soon come to an end  ♦
109.b: and his name be blotted out in the next generation.

109.a:
‘Let the wickedness of his fathers
    be remembered before the Lord,  ♦
109.b: and no sin of his mother be blotted out;

109.a: ‘Let their sin be always before the Lord,  ♦
109.b: that he may root out their name from the earth;

109.a: ‘Because he was not minded to keep faith,  ♦
109.b:
but persecuted the poor and needy
    and sought to kill the brokenhearted.

109.a: ‘He loved cursing and it came to him;  ♦
109.b: he took no delight in blessing and it was far from him.

109.a: ‘He clothed himself with cursing as with a garment:  ♦
109.b:
it seeped into his body like water
    and into his bones like oil;

109.a:
‘Let it be to him like the cloak
    which he wraps around him  ♦
109.b: and like the belt that he wears continually.’

109.a: Thus may the Lord repay my accusers  ♦
109.b: and those who speak evil against me.

109.a: But deal with me, O Lord my God, according to your name;  ♦
109.b: O deliver me, for sweet is your faithfulness.

109.a: For I am helpless and poor  ♦
109.b: and my heart is disquieted within me.

109.a: I fade like a shadow that lengthens;  ♦
109.b: I am shaken off like a locust.

109.a: My knees are weak through fasting  ♦
109.b: and my flesh is dried up and wasted.

109.a: I have become a reproach to them;  ♦
109.b: those who see me shake their heads in scorn.

109.a: Help me, O Lord my God;  ♦
109.b: save me for your loving mercy’s sake,

109.a: And they shall know that this is your hand,  ♦
109.b: that you, O Lord, have done it.

109.a: Though they curse, may you bless;  ♦
109.b:
let those who rise up against me be confounded,
    but let your servant rejoice.

109.a: Let my accusers be clothed with disgrace  ♦
109.b: and wrap themselves in their shame as in a cloak.

109.a: I will give great thanks to the Lord with my mouth;  ♦
109.b: in the midst of the multitude will I praise him;

109.a: Because he has stood at the right hand of the needy,  ♦
109.b: to save them from those who would condemn them.

110.a: The Lord said to my lord, ‘Sit at my right hand,  ♦
110.b: until I make your enemies your footstool.’

110.a: May the Lord stretch forth the sceptre of your power;  ♦
110.b: rule from Zion in the midst of your enemies.

110.a: ‘Noble are you on this day of your birth;  ♦
110.b:
on the holy mountain, from the womb of the dawn
    the dew of your new birth is upon you.’

110.a: The Lord has sworn and will not retract:  ♦
110.b: ‘You are a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.’

110.a: The king at your right hand, O Lord,  ♦
110.b: shall smite down kings in the day of his wrath.

110.a: In all his majesty, he shall judge among the nations,  ♦
110.b: smiting heads over all the wide earth.

110.a: He shall drink from the brook beside the way;  ♦
110.b: therefore shall he lift high his head.

111.a:
Alleluia.
I will give thanks to the Lord with my whole heart,  ♦
111.b: in the company of the faithful and in the congregation.

111.a: The works of the Lord are great,  ♦
111.b: sought out by all who delight in them.

111.a: His work is full of majesty and honour  ♦
111.b: and his righteousness endures for ever.

111.a: He appointed a memorial for his marvellous deeds;  ♦
111.b: the Lord is gracious and full of compassion.

111.a: He gave food to those who feared him;  ♦
111.b: he is ever mindful of his covenant.

111.a: He showed his people the power of his works  ♦
111.b: in giving them the heritage of the nations.

111.a: The works of his hands are truth and justice;  ♦
They stand fast for ever and ever;  ♦
111.b: they are done in truth and equity.

111.a:
He sent redemption to his people;
    he commanded his covenant for ever;  ♦
111.b: holy and awesome is his name.

111.a:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom;
    a good understanding have those who live by it;  ♦

112.a:
Alleluia.
Blessed are those who fear the Lord  ♦
112.b: and have great delight in his commandments.

112.a: Their descendants will be mighty in the land,  ♦
112.b: a generation of the faithful that will be blest.

112.a: Wealth and riches will be in their house,  ♦
112.b: and their righteousness endures for ever.

112.a: Light shines in the darkness for the upright;  ♦
112.b: gracious and full of compassion are the righteous.

112.a: It goes well with those who are generous in lending  ♦
112.b: and order their affairs with justice,

112.a: For they will never be shaken;  ♦
112.b: the righteous will be held in everlasting remembrance.

112.a: They will not be afraid of any evil tidings;  ♦
112.b: their heart is steadfast, trusting in the Lord.

112.a: Their heart is sustained and will not fear,  ♦
112.b: until they see the downfall of their foes.

112.a:
They have given freely to the poor;
    their righteousness stands fast for ever;  ♦
112.b: their head will be exalted with honour.

112.a:
The wicked shall see it and be angry;
    they shall gnash their teeth in despair;  ♦
112.b: the desire of the wicked shall perish.

113.a:
Alleluia.
Give praise, you servants of the Lord,  ♦
113.b: O praise the name of the Lord.

113.a: Blessed be the name of the Lord,  ♦
113.b: from this time forth and for evermore.

113.a: From the rising of the sun to its setting  ♦
113.b: let the name of the Lord be praised.

113.a: The Lord is high above all nations  ♦
113.b: and his glory above the heavens.

113.a:
Who is like the Lord our God,
    that has his throne so high,  ♦
113.b:
yet humbles himself to behold
    the things of heaven and earth?

113.a: He raises the poor from the dust  ♦
113.b: and lifts the needy from the ashes,
with the princes of his people.

113.a: He gives the barren woman a place in the house  ♦
113.b:
and makes her a joyful mother of children.
    Alleluia.

114.a: When Israel came out of Egypt,  ♦
114.b: the house of Jacob from a people of a strange tongue,

114.a: The sea saw that, and fled;  ♦

114.b: the little hills like young sheep.

114.a: What ailed you, O sea, that you fled?  ♦
114.b: O Jordan, that you were driven back?

114.a: You mountains, that you skipped like rams,  ♦
114.b: you little hills like young sheep?

114.a: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord,  ♦
114.b: at the presence of the God of Jacob,

114.a: Who turns the hard rock into a pool of water,  ♦
114.b: the flint-stone into a springing well.

115.a:
Not to us, Lord, not to us,
    but to your name give the glory,  ♦
115.b: for the sake of your loving mercy and truth.

115.a: As for our God, he is in heaven;  ♦
Their idols are silver and gold,  ♦
They have mouths, but cannot speak;  ♦
115.b: eyes have they, but cannot see;

115.a: They have ears, but cannot hear;  ♦
115.b: noses have they, but cannot smell;

115.a:
They have hands, but cannot feel;
    feet have they, but cannot walk;  ♦
115.b: not a whisper do they make from their throats.

115.a: Those who make them shall become like them  ♦
115.b: and so will all who put their trust in them.

115.a: But you, Israel, put your trust in the Lord;  ♦
115.b: he is their help and their shield.

115.a: House of Aaron, trust in the Lord;  ♦
115.b: he is their help and their shield.

115.a: You that fear the Lord, trust in the Lord;  ♦
115.b: he is their help and their shield.

115.a: The Lord has been mindful of us and he will bless us;  ♦
115.b:
may he bless the house of Israel;
    may he bless the house of Aaron;

115.a: May he bless those who fear the Lord,  ♦
May the Lord increase you more and more,  ♦
115.b: you and your children after you.

115.a: May you be blest by the Lord,  ♦
115.b: the maker of heaven and earth.

115.a: The heavens are the heavens of the Lord,  ♦
115.b: but the earth he has entrusted to his children.

115.a: The dead do not praise the Lord,  ♦
115.b: nor those gone down into silence;

115.a: But we will bless the Lord,  ♦
115.b:
from this time forth for evermore.
    Alleluia.

116.a:
I love the Lord,
    for he has heard the voice of my supplication;  ♦
116.b:
because he inclined his ear to me
    on the day I called to him.

116.a:
The snares of death encompassed me;
    the pains of hell took hold of me;  ♦
116.b: by grief and sorrow was I held.

116.a: Then I called upon the name of the Lord:  ♦
116.b: ‘O Lord, I beg you, deliver my soul.’

116.a: Gracious is the Lord and righteous;  ♦
116.b: our God is full of compassion.

116.a: The Lord watches over the simple;  ♦
116.b: I was brought very low and he saved me.

116.a: Turn again to your rest, O my soul,  ♦
116.b: for the Lord has been gracious to you.

116.a: For you have delivered my soul from death,  ♦
116.b: my eyes from tears and my feet from falling.

116.a: I will walk before the Lord  ♦
116.b: in the land of the living.

116.a:
I believed that I should perish
    for I was sorely troubled;  ♦
116.b:
and I said in my alarm,
    ‘Everyone is a liar.’

116.a: How shall I repay the Lord  ♦
116.b: for all the benefits he has given to me?

116.a: I will lift up the cup of salvation  ♦
116.b: and call upon the name of the Lord.

116.a: I will fulfil my vows to the Lord  ♦
116.b: in the presence of all his people.

116.a: Precious in the sight of the Lord  ♦
116.b: is the death of his faithful servants.

116.a: O Lord, I am your servant,  ♦
116.b:
your servant, the child of your handmaid;
    you have freed me from my bonds.

116.a: I will offer to you a sacrifice of thanksgiving  ♦
116.b: and call upon the name of the Lord.

116.a: I will fulfil my vows to the Lord  ♦
116.b: in the presence of all his people,

116.a: In the courts of the house of the Lord,  ♦
116.b:
in the midst of you, O Jerusalem.
    Alleluia.

117.a: O praise the Lord, all you nations;  ♦
For great is his steadfast love towards us,  ♦
117.b:
and the faithfulness of the Lord endures for ever.
    Alleluia.

118.a: O give thanks to the Lord, for he is good;  ♦
118.b: his mercy endures for ever.

118.a: Let Israel now proclaim,  ♦
118.b: ‘His mercy endures for ever.’

118.a: Let the house of Aaron now proclaim,  ♦
118.b: ‘His mercy endures for ever.’

118.a: Let those who fear the Lord proclaim,  ♦
118.b: ‘His mercy endures for ever.’

118.a: In my constraint I called to the Lord;  ♦
118.b: the Lord answered and set me free.

118.a: The Lord is at my side; I will not fear;  ♦
118.b: what can flesh do to me?

118.a: With the Lord at my side as my saviour,  ♦
118.b: I shall see the downfall of my enemies.

118.a: It is better to take refuge in the Lord  ♦
118.b: than to put any confidence in flesh.

118.a: It is better to take refuge in the Lord  ♦
118.b: than to put any confidence in princes.

118.a: All the nations encompassed me,  ♦
118.b: but by the name of the Lord I drove them back.

118.a: They hemmed me in, they hemmed me in on every side,  ♦
118.b: but by the name of the Lord I drove them back.

118.a:
They swarmed about me like bees;
    they blazed like fire among thorns,  ♦
118.b: but by the name of the Lord I drove them back.

118.a: Surely, I was thrust to the brink,  ♦
118.b: but the Lord came to my help.

118.a: The Lord is my strength and my song,  ♦
118.b: and he has become my salvation.

118.a: Joyful shouts of salvation  ♦
118.b: sound from the tents of the righteous:

118.a:
‘The right hand of the Lord does mighty deeds;
    the right hand of the Lord raises up;  ♦
118.b: the right hand of the Lord does mighty deeds.’

118.a: I shall not die, but live  ♦
118.b: and declare the works of the Lord.

118.a: The Lord has punished me sorely,  ♦
118.b: but he has not given me over to death.

118.a: Open to me the gates of righteousness,  ♦
118.b: that I may enter and give thanks to the Lord.

118.a: This is the gate of the Lord;  ♦
118.b: the righteous shall enter through it.

118.a: I will give thanks to you, for you have answered me  ♦

128.b:
that you may see Jerusalem in prosperity
    all the days of your life.

128.a: May you see your children’s children,  ♦
128.b: and may there be peace upon Israel.

129.a: ‘Many a time have they fought against me from my youth,’  ♦
‘Many a time have they fought against me from my youth,  ♦
129.b: but they have not prevailed against me.’

129.a: The ploughers ploughed upon my back  ♦

129.b: has cut the cords of the wicked in pieces.

129.a: Let them be put to shame and turned backwards,  ♦
129.b: as many as are enemies of Zion.

129.a: Let them be like grass upon the housetops,  ♦
129.b: which withers before it can grow,

129.a: So that no reaper can fill his hand,  ♦
129.b: nor a binder of sheaves his bosom;

129.a:
And none who go by may say,
    ‘The blessing of the Lord be upon you.  ♦
129.b: We bless you in the name of the Lord.’

130.a:
Out of the depths have I cried to you, O Lord;
    Lord, hear my voice;  ♦
130.b: let your ears consider well the voice of my supplication.

130.a: If you, Lord, were to mark what is done amiss,  ♦
But there is forgiveness with you,  ♦
130.b: so that you shall be feared.

130.a: I wait for the Lord; my soul waits for him;  ♦
130.b: in his word is my hope.

130.a:
My soul waits for the Lord,
    more than the night watch for the morning,  ♦
130.b: more than the night watch for the morning.

130.a: O Israel, wait for the Lord,  ♦
130.b: for with the Lord there is mercy;
and he shall redeem Israel from all their sins.

131.a: O Lord, my heart is not proud;  ♦
131.b: my eyes are not raised in haughty looks.

131.a: I do not occupy myself with great matters,  ♦
131.b: with things that are too high for me.

131.a:
But I have quieted and stilled my soul,
    like a weaned child on its mother’s breast;  ♦
131.b: so my soul is quieted within me.

131.a: O Israel, trust in the Lord,  ♦
131.b: from this time forth for evermore.

132.a: How he swore an oath to the Lord  ♦
132.b: and vowed a vow to the Mighty One of Jacob:

132.a: ‘I will not come within the shelter of my house,  ♦
132.b: nor climb up into my bed;

132.a: ‘I will not allow my eyes to sleep,  ♦
‘Until I find a place for the Lord,  ♦
132.b: a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.’

132.a: Now, we heard of the ark in Ephrathah  ♦
132.b: and found it in the fields of Ja-ar.

132.a: Let us enter his dwelling place  ♦
132.b: and fall low before his footstool.

132.a: Arise, O Lord, into your resting place,  ♦
132.b: you and the ark of your strength.

132.a: Let your priests be clothed with righteousness  ♦
132.b: and your faithful ones sing with joy.
turn not away the face of your anointed.

132.a: The Lord has sworn an oath to David,  ♦
132.b: a promise from which he will not shrink:
shall I set upon your throne.

132.a:
‘If your children keep my covenant
    and my testimonies that I shall teach them,  ♦
132.b: their children also shall sit upon your throne for evermore.’

132.a: For the Lord has chosen Zion for himself;  ♦
132.b: he has desired her for his habitation:

132.a: ‘This shall be my resting place for ever;  ♦
132.b: here will I dwell, for I have longed for her.
her poor will I satisfy with bread.

132.a: ‘I will clothe her priests with salvation,  ♦
132.b: and her faithful ones shall rejoice and sing.

132.a: ‘There will I make a horn to spring up for David;  ♦
132.b: I will keep a lantern burning for my anointed.

132.a: ‘As for his enemies, I will clothe them with shame;  ♦
132.b: but on him shall his crown be bright.’

133.a: Behold how good and pleasant it is  ♦
It is like the precious oil upon the head,  ♦

133.b: running down upon the collar of his clothing.

133.a: It is like the dew of Hermon  ♦
133.b: running down upon the hills of Zion.

133.a: For there the Lord has promised his blessing:  ♦

134.a: Come, bless the Lord, all you servants of the Lord,  ♦
134.b: you that by night stand in the house of the Lord.

134.a: Lift up your hands towards the sanctuary  ♦
The Lord who made heaven and earth  ♦
134.b: give you blessing out of Zion.

135.a:
Alleluia.
Praise the name of the Lord;  ♦
135.b: give praise, you servants of the Lord,

135.a: You that stand in the house of the Lord,  ♦
135.b: in the courts of the house of our God.

135.a: Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good;  ♦
135.b: make music to his name, for it is lovely.

135.a: For the Lord has chosen Jacob for himself  ♦
135.b: and Israel for his own possession.

135.a: For I know that the Lord is great  ♦
135.b: and that our Lord is above all gods.

135.a:
The Lord does whatever he pleases
    in heaven and on earth,  ♦
135.b: in the seas and in all the deeps.

135.a: He brings up the clouds from the ends of the earth;  ♦
135.b:
he makes lightning with the rain
    and brings the winds out of his treasuries.

135.a: He smote the firstborn of Egypt,  ♦
135.b: the firstborn of man and beast.

135.a: He sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt,  ♦
135.b: upon Pharaoh and all his servants.

135.a: He smote many nations  ♦
135.b: and slew mighty kings:

135.a:
Sihon, king of the Amorites,
    and Og, the king of Bashan,  ♦
135.b: and all the kingdoms of Canaan.

135.a: He gave their land as a heritage,  ♦
135.b: a heritage for Israel his people.

135.a: Your name, O Lord, endures for ever  ♦
135.b: and shall be remembered through all generations.

135.a: For the Lord will vindicate his people  ♦
135.b: and have compassion on his servants.

135.a: The idols of the nations are but silver and gold,  ♦
135.b: the work of human hands.

135.a: They have mouths, but cannot speak;  ♦
135.b: eyes have they, but cannot see;

135.a: They have ears, but cannot hear;  ♦
135.b: neither is there any breath in their mouths.

135.a: Those who make them shall become like them,  ♦
135.b: and so will all who put their trust in them.

135.a: Bless the Lord, O house of Israel;  ♦
135.b: O house of Aaron, bless the Lord.

135.a: Bless the Lord, O house of Levi;  ♦
135.b: you who fear the Lord, bless the Lord.

135.a: Blessed be the Lord from Zion,  ♦
135.b:
who dwells in Jerusalem.
    Alleluia.

136.a: Give thanks to the Lord, for he is gracious,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever.

136.a: Give thanks to the God of gods,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever.

136.a: Give thanks to the Lord of lords,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: Who alone does great wonders,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: Who by wisdom made the heavens,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: Who laid out the earth upon the waters,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: Who made the great lights,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: The sun to rule the day,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: The moon and the stars to govern the night,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: Who smote the firstborn of Egypt,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: And brought out Israel from among them,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: With a mighty hand and outstretched arm,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: Who divided the Red Sea in two,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: But Pharaoh and his host he overthrew in the Red Sea,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: Who led his people through the wilderness,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: Who smote great kings,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: And slew mighty kings,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: Sihon, king of the Amorites,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: And Og, the king of Bashan,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: And gave away their land for a heritage,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: A heritage for Israel his servant,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: Who remembered us when we were in trouble,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: And delivered us from our enemies,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever;

136.a: Who gives food to all creatures,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever.

136.a: Give thanks to the God of heaven,  ♦
136.b: for his mercy endures for ever.

137.a: By the waters of Babylon we sat down and wept,  ♦
As for our lyres, we hung them up  ♦
137.b: on the willows that grow in that land.

137.a:
For there our captors asked for a song,
    our tormentors called for mirth:  ♦
137.b: ‘Sing us one of the songs of Zion.’

137.a: How shall we sing the Lord’s song  ♦
If I forget you, O Jerusalem,  ♦
137.b: let my right hand forget its skill.

137.a:
Let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth
    if I do not remember you,  ♦
137.b: if I set not Jerusalem above my highest joy.

137.a:
Remember, O Lord, against the people of Edom
    the day of Jerusalem,  ♦
137.b:
how they said, ‘Down with it,
    down with it, even to the ground.’

137.a: O daughter of Babylon, doomed to destruction,  ♦
137.b:
happy the one who repays you
    for all you have done to us;
and dashes them against the rock.

138.a: I will give thanks to you, O Lord, with my whole heart;  ♦
138.b: before the gods will I sing praise to you.

138.a:
I will bow down towards your holy temple and praise your name,
    because of your love and faithfulness;  ♦
138.b:
for you have glorified your name
    and your word above all things.

138.a: In the day that I called to you, you answered me;  ♦
138.b: you put new strength in my soul.

138.a: All the kings of the earth shall praise you, O Lord,  ♦
138.b: for they have heard the words of your mouth.

138.a: They shall sing of the ways of the Lord,  ♦
138.b: that great is the glory of the Lord.

138.a: Though the Lord be high, he watches over the lowly;  ♦
138.b: as for the proud, he regards them from afar.

138.a:
Though I walk in the midst of trouble,
    you will preserve me;  ♦
138.b:
you will stretch forth your hand against the fury of my enemies;
    your right hand will save me.

138.a: The Lord shall make good his purpose for me;  ♦
138.b:
your loving-kindness, O Lord, endures for ever;
    forsake not the work of your hands.

139.a: O Lord, you have searched me out and known me;  ♦
139.b:
you know my sitting down and my rising up;
    you discern my thoughts from afar.

139.a: You mark out my journeys and my resting place  ♦
139.b: and are acquainted with all my ways.

139.a: For there is not a word on my tongue,  ♦
139.b: but you, O Lord, know it altogether.

139.a: You encompass me behind and before  ♦
139.b: and lay your hand upon me.

139.a: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me,  ♦
139.b: so high that I cannot attain it.

139.a: Where can I go then from your spirit?  ♦
139.b: Or where can I flee from your presence?

139.a: If I climb up to heaven, you are there;  ♦
139.b: if I make the grave my bed, you are there also.

139.a: If I take the wings of the morning  ♦
139.b: and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,

139.a: Even there your hand shall lead me,  ♦
139.b: your right hand hold me fast.

139.a: If I say, ‘Surely the darkness will cover me  ♦
139.b: and the light around me turn to night,’

139.a:
Even darkness is no darkness with you;
    the night is as clear as the day;  ♦
139.b: darkness and light to you are both alike.

139.a: For you yourself created my inmost parts;  ♦
139.b: you knit me together in my mother’s womb.

139.a: I thank you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made;  ♦
139.b: marvellous are your works, my soul knows well.

139.a: My frame was not hidden from you,  ♦
139.b:
when I was made in secret
    and woven in the depths of the earth.

139.a: Your eyes beheld my form, as yet unfinished;  ♦
139.b: already in your book were all my members written,

139.a: As day by day they were fashioned  ♦
139.b: when as yet there was none of them.

139.a: How deep are your counsels to me, O God!  ♦
139.b: How great is the sum of them!

139.a: If I count them, they are more in number than the sand,  ♦
139.b: and at the end, I am still in your presence.

139.a: O that you would slay the wicked, O God,  ♦
139.b: that the bloodthirsty might depart from me!

139.a: They speak against you with wicked intent;  ♦
139.b: your enemies take up your name for evil.

139.a: Do I not oppose those, O Lord, who oppose you?  ♦
139.b: Do I not abhor those who rise up against you?

139.a: I hate them with a perfect hatred;  ♦
139.b: they have become my own enemies also.

139.a: Search me out, O God, and know my heart;  ♦
139.b: try me and examine my thoughts.

139.a: See if there is any way of wickedness in me  ♦
139.b: and lead me in the way everlasting.

140.a: Deliver me, O Lord, from evildoers  ♦
140.b: and protect me from the violent,

140.a: Who devise evil in their hearts  ♦
140.b: and stir up strife all the day long.

140.a: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent;  ♦
140.b: adder’s poison is under their lips.

140.a: Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the wicked;  ♦
140.b:
protect me from the violent
    who seek to make me stumble.

140.a:
The proud have laid a snare for me
    and spread out a net of cords;  ♦
140.b: they have set traps along my path.

140.a: I have said to the Lord, ‘You are my God;  ♦
140.b: listen, O Lord, to the voice of my supplication.

140.a: ‘O Lord God, the strength of my salvation,  ♦
140.b: you have covered my head in the day of battle.

140.a: ‘Do not grant the desires of the wicked, O Lord,  ♦
140.b: do not prosper their wicked plans.

140.a: ‘Let not those who surround me lift up their heads;  ♦
140.b: let the evil of their own lips fall upon them.

140.a: ‘Let hot burning coals rain upon them;  ♦
140.b: let them be cast into the depths, that they rise not again.’

140.a: No slanderer shall prosper on the earth,  ♦
140.b: and evil shall hunt down the violent to overthrow them.

140.a: I know that the Lord will bring justice for the oppressed  ♦
140.b: and maintain the cause of the needy.

140.a: Surely, the righteous will give thanks to your name,  ♦
140.b: and the upright shall dwell in your presence.

141.a: O Lord, I call to you; come to me quickly;  ♦
141.b: hear my voice when I cry to you.

141.a: Let my prayer rise before you as incense,  ♦
141.b: the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.

141.a: Set a watch before my mouth, O Lord,  ♦
141.b: and guard the door of my lips;

141.a: Let not my heart incline to any evil thing;  ♦
141.b:
let me not be occupied in wickedness with evildoers,
    nor taste the pleasures of their table.

141.a:
Let the righteous smite me in friendly rebuke;
    but let not the oil of the unrighteous anoint my head;  ♦
141.b: for my prayer is continually against their wicked deeds.

141.a: Let their rulers be overthrown in stony places;  ♦
141.b: then they may know that my words are sweet.

141.a: As when a plough turns over the earth in furrows,  ♦
141.b: let their bones be scattered at the mouth of the Pit.

141.a: But my eyes are turned to you, Lord God;  ♦
141.b: in you I take refuge; do not leave me defenceless.

141.a: Protect me from the snare which they have laid for me  ♦
141.b: and from the traps of the evildoers.

141.a: Let the wicked fall into their own nets,  ♦
141.b: while I pass by in safety.

142.a: I cry aloud to the Lord;  ♦
142.b: to the Lord I make my supplication.

142.a: I pour out my complaint before him  ♦
142.b: and tell him of my trouble.

142.a: When my spirit faints within me, you know my path;  ♦
142.b: in the way wherein I walk have they laid a snare for me.

142.a: I look to my right hand, and find no one who knows me;  ♦
142.b: I have no place to flee to, and no one cares for my soul.

142.a: I cry out to you, O Lord, and say:  ♦
142.b: ‘You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.

142.a: ‘Listen to my cry, for I am brought very low;  ♦
142.b: save me from my persecutors, for they are too strong for me.

142.a:
‘Bring my soul out of prison,
    that I may give thanks to your name;  ♦
142.b:
when you have dealt bountifully with me,
    then shall the righteous gather around me.’

143.a:
Hear my prayer, O Lord,
    and in your faithfulness give ear to my supplications;  ♦
Enter not into judgement with your servant,  ♦
143.b: for in your sight shall no one living be justified.

143.a:
For the enemy has pursued me,
    crushing my life to the ground,  ♦
143.b: making me sit in darkness like those long dead.
my heart within me is desolate.

143.a: I remember the time past; I muse upon all your deeds;  ♦
143.b: I consider the works of your hands.

143.a: I stretch out my hands to you;  ♦
143.b: my soul gasps for you like a thirsty land.

143.a: O Lord, make haste to answer me; my spirit fails me;  ♦
143.b:
hide not your face from me
    lest I be like those who go down to the Pit.

143.a:
Let me hear of your loving-kindness in the morning,
    for in you I put my trust;  ♦
143.b:
show me the way I should walk in,
    for I lift up my soul to you.

143.a: Deliver me, O Lord, from my enemies,  ♦
143.b: for I flee to you for refuge.

143.a: Teach me to do what pleases you, for you are my God;  ♦
143.b: let your kindly spirit lead me on a level path.

143.a: Revive me, O Lord, for your name’s sake;  ♦
143.b: for your righteousness’ sake, bring me out of trouble.

143.a:
In your faithfulness, slay my enemies,
    and destroy all the adversaries of my soul,  ♦
143.b: for truly I am your servant.

144.a: Blessed be the Lord my rock,  ♦
144.b: who teaches my hands for war and my fingers for battle;

144.a:
My steadfast help and my fortress,
    my stronghold and my deliverer,
    my shield in whom I trust,  ♦
144.b: who subdues the peoples under me.

144.a: O Lord, what are mortals that you should consider them;  ♦
144.b: mere human beings, that you should take thought for them?

144.a: They are like a breath of wind;  ♦
144.b: their days pass away like a shadow.

144.a: Bow your heavens, O Lord, and come down;  ♦
144.b: touch the mountains and they shall smoke.

144.a: Cast down your lightnings and scatter them;  ♦
144.b: shoot out your arrows and let thunder roar.

144.a: Reach down your hand from on high;  ♦
144.b:
deliver me and take me out of the great waters,
    from the hand of foreign enemies,
and their right hand is the hand of falsehood.

144.a: O God, I will sing to you a new song;  ♦
144.b: I will play to you on a ten-stringed harp,

144.a: You that give salvation to kings  ♦
144.b: and have delivered David your servant.

144.a: Save me from the peril of the sword  ♦
144.b: and deliver me from the hand of foreign enemies,
and whose right hand is the hand of falsehood;

144.a:
So that our sons in their youth
    may be like well-nurtured plants,  ♦
144.b:
and our daughters like pillars
    carved for the corners of the temple;

144.a: Our barns be filled with all manner of store;  ♦
144.b:
our flocks bearing thousands,
    and ten thousands in our fields;

144.a: Our cattle be heavy with young:  ♦
144.b:
may there be no miscarriage or untimely birth,
    no cry of distress in our streets.

144.a: Happy are the people whose blessing this is.  ♦
144.b: Happy are the people who have the Lord for their God.

145.a: I will exalt you, O God my King,  ♦
145.b: and bless your name for ever and ever.

145.a: Every day will I bless you  ♦
145.b: and praise your name for ever and ever.

145.a: Great is the Lord and highly to be praised;  ♦
145.b: his greatness is beyond all searching out.

145.a: One generation shall praise your works to another  ♦
145.b: and declare your mighty acts.

145.a: They shall speak of the majesty of your glory,  ♦
145.b: and I will tell of all your wonderful deeds.

145.a: They shall speak of the might of your marvellous acts,  ♦
145.b: and I will also tell of your greatness.

145.a: They shall pour forth the story of your abundant kindness  ♦
145.b: and joyfully sing of your righteousness.

145.a: The Lord is gracious and merciful,  ♦
145.b: long-suffering and of great goodness.

145.a: The Lord is loving to everyone  ♦
145.b: and his mercy is over all his creatures.

145.a: All your works praise you, O Lord,  ♦
145.b: and your faithful servants bless you.

145.a: They tell of the glory of your kingdom  ♦
145.b: and speak of your mighty power,

145.a: To make known to all peoples your mighty acts  ♦
145.b: and the glorious splendour of your kingdom.

145.a: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom;  ♦
145.b: your dominion endures throughout all ages.

145.a: The Lord is sure in all his words  ♦
145.b: and faithful in all his deeds.

145.a: The Lord upholds all those who fall  ♦
145.b: and lifts up all those who are bowed down.

145.a: The eyes of all wait upon you, O Lord,  ♦
145.b: and you give them their food in due season.

145.a: You open wide your hand  ♦
145.b: and fill all things living with plenty.

145.a: The Lord is righteous in all his ways  ♦
145.b: and loving in all his works.

145.a: The Lord is near to those who call upon him,  ♦
145.b: to all who call upon him faithfully.

145.a: He fulfils the desire of those who fear him;  ♦
145.b: he hears their cry and saves them.

145.a: The Lord watches over those who love him,  ♦
145.b: but all the wicked shall he destroy.

145.a: My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord,  ♦
145.b: and let all flesh bless his holy name for ever and ever.

146.a:
Alleluia.
    Praise the Lord, O my soul:
    while I live will I praise the Lord;  ♦
146.b:
as long as I have any being,
    I will sing praises to my God.

146.a:
Put not your trust in princes,
    nor in any human power,  ♦
146.b: for there is no help in them.

146.a: When their breath goes forth, they return to the earth;  ♦
146.b: on that day all their thoughts perish.

146.a: Happy are those who have the God of Jacob for their help,  ♦
146.b: whose hope is in the Lord their God;

146.a:
Who made heaven and earth,
    the sea and all that is in them;  ♦
146.b: who keeps his promise for ever;

146.a: Who gives justice to those that suffer wrong  ♦
146.b: and bread to those who hunger.

146.a: The Lord looses those that are bound;  ♦
146.b: the Lord opens the eyes of the blind;

146.a: The Lord lifts up those who are bowed down;  ♦

The Lord watches over the stranger in the land;
    he upholds the orphan and widow;  ♦
146.b: but the way of the wicked he turns upside down.

146.a: The Lord shall reign for ever,  ♦
146.b:
your God, O Zion, throughout all generations.
    Alleluia.

147.a:
Alleluia.
How good it is to make music for our God,  ♦
147.b: how joyful to honour him with praise.

147.a: The Lord builds up Jerusalem  ♦
147.b: and gathers together the outcasts of Israel.

147.a: He heals the brokenhearted  ♦
147.b: and binds up all their wounds.

147.a: He counts the number of the stars  ♦
147.b: and calls them all by their names.

147.a: Great is our Lord and mighty in power;  ♦
147.b: his wisdom is beyond all telling.

147.a: The Lord lifts up the poor,  ♦
147.b: but casts down the wicked to the ground.

147.a: Sing to the Lord with thanksgiving;  ♦
147.b: make music to our God upon the lyre;

147.a: Who covers the heavens with clouds  ♦
147.b: and prepares rain for the earth;

147.a: Who makes grass to grow upon the mountains  ♦
147.b: and green plants to serve our needs.

147.a: He gives the beasts their food  ♦
147.b: and the young ravens when they cry.

147.a: He takes no pleasure in the power of a horse,  ♦
147.b: no delight in human strength;

147.a: But the Lord delights in those who fear him,  ♦
147.b: who put their trust in his steadfast love.

147.a: Sing praise to the Lord, O Jerusalem;  ♦
147.b: praise your God, O Zion;

147.a: For he has strengthened the bars of your gates  ♦
147.b: and has blest your children within you.

147.a: He has established peace in your borders  ♦
147.b: and satisfies you with the finest wheat.

147.a: He sends forth his command to the earth  ♦
147.b: and his word runs very swiftly.

147.a: He gives snow like wool  ♦
147.b: and scatters the hoarfrost like ashes.

147.a: He casts down his hailstones like morsels of bread;  ♦
147.b: who can endure his frost?

147.a: He sends forth his word and melts them;  ♦
147.b: he blows with his wind and the waters flow.

147.a: He declares his word to Jacob,  ♦
147.b: his statutes and judgements to Israel.

147.a: He has not dealt so with any other nation;  ♦
147.b:
they do not know his laws.
    Alleluia.

148.a:
Alleluia.
Praise the Lord from the heavens;  ♦
Praise him, all you his angels;  ♦

148.b: praise him, all you stars of light.
and you waters above the heavens.

148.a: Let them praise the name of the Lord,  ♦
148.b: for he commanded and they were created.

148.a: He made them fast for ever and ever;  ♦
148.b: he gave them a law which shall not pass away.

148.a: Praise the Lord from the earth,  ♦
148.b: you sea monsters and all deeps;

148.a: Fire and hail, snow and mist,  ♦

148.b: creeping things and birds on the wing;

148.a: Kings of the earth and all peoples,  ♦
148.b: princes and all rulers of the world;

148.a:
Young men and women,
    old and young together;  ♦
148.b: let them praise the name of the Lord.

148.a: For his name only is exalted,  ♦
148.b: his splendour above earth and heaven.

148.a:
He has raised up the horn of his people
    and praise for all his faithful servants,  ♦
148.b:
the children of Israel, a people who are near him.
    Alleluia.

149.a:
Alleluia.
O sing to the Lord a new song;  ♦
149.b: sing his praise in the congregation of the faithful.

149.a: Let Israel rejoice in their maker;  ♦
149.b: let the children of Zion be joyful in their king.

149.a: Let them praise his name in the dance;  ♦
149.b: let them sing praise to him with timbrel and lyre.

149.a: For the Lord has pleasure in his people  ♦
149.b: and adorns the poor with salvation.

149.a: Let the faithful be joyful in glory;  ♦
149.b: let them rejoice in their ranks,

149.a: With the praises of God in their mouths  ♦
149.b: and a two-edged sword in their hands;

149.a: To execute vengeance on the nations  ♦
To bind their kings in chains  ♦
149.b: and their nobles with fetters of iron;

149.a: To execute on them the judgement decreed:  ♦
149.b:
such honour have all his faithful servants.
    Alleluia.

150.a:
Alleluia.
O praise God in his holiness;  ♦
150.b: praise him in the firmament of his power.

150.a: Praise him for his mighty acts;  ♦
150.b: praise him according to his excellent greatness.

150.a: Praise him with the blast of the trumpet;  ♦
150.b: praise him upon the harp and lyre.

150.a: Praise him with timbrel and dances;  ♦
150.b: praise him upon the strings and pipe.
praise him upon the clashing cymbals.
